title: Proverbs 1:1
content: 1 {These are} the wise sayings said by Solomon. {He was} David’s son and Israel’s king.

title: Proverbs 1:2
content: 2 {These wise sayings are} for knowing what is wise and instructive. {They are} for understanding insightful things that people say.

title: Proverbs 1:3
content: 3 {These wise sayings are} for instructing someone about what is insightful, righteous, just, and honest.

title: Proverbs 1:4
content: 4 {They are} for making naive people prudent, and {for making} young people knowledgeable and discreet.

title: Proverbs 1:5
content: 5 (Wise people will listen {to these wise sayings} and learn more. Indeed, understanding people will know {what to do} because these sayings will guide them.)

title: Proverbs 1:6
content: 6 {These wise sayings are} for understanding wise sayings and parables. {Indeed, they are for understanding} what wise people say and the riddles they tell.

title: Proverbs 1:7
content: 7 Reverently fearing Yahweh is necessary for being knowledgeable. {But} foolish people detest what is wise or instructive.

title: Proverbs 1:8
content: 8 My child, listen carefully to what I, your father, am teaching you. Indeed, obey the rules that your mother has commanded.

title: Proverbs 1:9
content: 9 {Obey your parents’ teaching} because it {will make you respectable, as if it} were an attractive wreath on your head, or beautiful necklaces around your neck.

title: Proverbs 1:10
content: 10 My child, if sinful people tempt you {to sin with them}, refuse {to do so}.

title: Proverbs 1:11
content: 11 Those sinful people may say, “Join us! We will hide and wait in order to kill someone {who walks by}. Indeed, we will hide ourselves in order to suddenly attack an innocent person for no good reason.

title: Proverbs 1:12
content: 12 We will kill living people completely, as if we were death itself. {We will even kill} healthy people, as if they could not escape dying.

title: Proverbs 1:13
content: 13 We will discover many valuable treasures! We will fill our houses with what we steal!

title: Proverbs 1:14
content: 14 Join our gang! We will share all the loot between us.”

title: Proverbs 1:15
content: 15 My child, do not associate with those sinful people! Prevent yourself from doing anything they do!

title: Proverbs 1:16
content: 16 {Avoid those sinners} because they are eager to do wicked things. They even rush to murder people.

title: Proverbs 1:17
content: 17 It is useless {for a hunter} to put out a net {to trap a bird} while the bird is watching {because the bird will avoid the net}.

title: Proverbs 1:18
content: 18 However, {these sinful people are more foolish than birds.} They {actually} hide in wait, so that they kill themselves. Indeed, they hide themselves to suddenly attack, so that they die.

title: Proverbs 1:19
content: 19 That is what happens to anyone who gains wealth in an unjust manner. What they gained unjustly will kill them.

title: Proverbs 1:20
content: 20 What is wise {is like a woman who} calls out {to everyone} in public. Indeed, what is wise {is like a woman who} shouts {to people} in crowded places.

title: Proverbs 1:21
content: 21 Indeed, at the place where busy streets intersect she cries out. Indeed, at the {crowded} entrance of the city gates she speaks.

title: Proverbs 1:22
content: 22 She cries, “You naive people have loved being naive for too long! You people who ridicule have enjoyed ridiculing to benefit yourselves for too long! You foolish people have hated what you should know for too long!

title: Proverbs 1:23
content: 23 Turn around {and listen} to me when I correct you! Pay attention! I will tell you all that I am thinking. Indeed, I will help you understand what I am saying to you.

title: Proverbs 1:24
content: 24 I cried out {to you}, but you refused {to listen}. Indeed, I invited you to come to me, but no one paid any attention {to me}.

title: Proverbs 1:25
content: 25 You ignored everything I advised {you to do}. Indeed, you rejected what I said to correct you.

title: Proverbs 1:26
content: 26 Therefore, as for me, I will laugh at you when disastrous things happen to you. Indeed, I will ridicule you when you are terrified.

title: Proverbs 1:27
content: 27 {I will ridicule you} when you are terrified, as if a violent storm has arrived, {when} disastrous things happen to you violently, {and} when you become distressed and anguished!

title: Proverbs 1:28
content: 28 At that time, those foolish people will cry out to me {to help them}, but I will not reply {to them}. Indeed, they will desperately try to find me, but they will not be able to.

title: Proverbs 1:29
content: 29 {Those foolish people will not find me} because they refuse to be knowledgeable. They have also decided not to reverently fear Yahweh.

title: Proverbs 1:30
content: 30 Those foolish people rejected what I advised {them to do}. Indeed, they detested everything I said to correct them.

title: Proverbs 1:31
content: 31 Those foolish people will suffer rightly for what they have done. Indeed, they will suffer fully for what they have planned.

title: Proverbs 1:32
content: 32 Ultimately, naive people will die because they refuse {to be wise}. Indeed, being complacent will destroy foolish people.

title: Proverbs 1:33
content: 33 By contrast, people who listen attentively to what I say will live safely. They will not fear that something evil might happen to them.”

title: Proverbs 2:1
content: 1 My child, accept what I say. Consider what I command {you} to be precious.

title: Proverbs 2:2
content: 2 {Do this by} listening attentively to what is wise, {and by} thinking seriously about what you should understand.

title: Proverbs 2:3
content: 3 Yes, cry out to learn what you should understand. Cry loudly to learn what you should perceive!

title: Proverbs 2:4
content: 4 Try to learn what is wise, like you would try to find silver. Indeed, look eagerly for it, like you would look for a treasure that someone has hidden.

title: Proverbs 2:5
content: 5 {If you do those things,} then you will understand how to reverently fear Yahweh. You will even succeed in knowing God.

title: Proverbs 2:6
content: 6 {This is} because Yahweh provides people with what is wise. He tells them what they should know and understand.

title: Proverbs 2:7
content: 7 He gives what is truly wise to upright people. He protects people who behave honestly.

title: Proverbs 2:8
content: 8 {He does these things} in order to guard those people who live justly. Indeed, he keeps safe those people who are faithful to him.

title: Proverbs 2:9
content: 9 {If you listen to me,} then you will understand what is righteous, just, and honest, {even} the best way to behave.

title: Proverbs 2:10
content: 10 {This is because} you will truly know what is wise, and knowing what you should know will please you.

title: Proverbs 2:11
content: 11 Being discreet will make you safe. Indeed, being insightful will make you secure.

title: Proverbs 2:12
content: 12 {Being like this will protect you} in order to save you from people who behave wickedly {and save you} from people who speak perversely.

title: Proverbs 2:13
content: 13 Those people refuse to behave righteously in order to behave wickedly.

title: Proverbs 2:14
content: 14 They gladly do evil things. They enjoy evil and perverse acts.

title: Proverbs 2:15
content: 15 They behave deceptively. Indeed, they act deviously.

title: Proverbs 2:16
content: 16 {Being discreet and insightful will protect you also} in order to save you from adulterous women, {and to save you} from immoral women who speak {to you} seductively.

title: Proverbs 2:17
content: 17 Those women left the husbands they married when they were young. They even forgot what they had promised to God {when they married}.

title: Proverbs 2:18
content: 18 {Being discreet and insightful will rescue you} because {going to} such a woman’s house will result in you dying. Indeed, going with her will result in you going to the place where the spirits of dead people are.

title: Proverbs 2:19
content: 19 No one who acts adulterously with her will live again. They will never become alive again!

title: Proverbs 2:20
content: 20 Therefore, behave like a good person. Indeed, conduct yourself like a righteous person.

title: Proverbs 2:21
content: 21 Ultimately, people who live uprightly will live in our land, Indeed, people whom Yahweh does not blame {for acting wickedly} will stay in this land for a long time.

title: Proverbs 2:22
content: 22 By contrast, Yahweh will remove people who act wickedly from our land. Yahweh will completely remove people who act treacherously from this land!

title: Proverbs 3:1
content: 1 My child, remember the rules I have taught you! Always be mindful to obey what I have commanded you!

title: Proverbs 3:2
content: 2 {Do this} because {obeying} what I have commanded you will help you live for a long time with many fulfilling and peaceful years.

title: Proverbs 3:3
content: 3 Always be faithful and trustworthy. Let everyone see {how faithful and trustworthy you are, as if} they were a necklace you are wearing. Remember to be faithful and trustworthy at all times.

title: Proverbs 3:4
content: 4 As a result of doing so, both God and people will approve of you and think well of you.

title: Proverbs 3:5
content: 5 Trust Yahweh completely, and do not rely on what you understand.

title: Proverbs 3:6
content: 6 Remember Yahweh whenever you do anything. As a result {of doing so}, he will show you what you should do.

title: Proverbs 3:7
content: 7 Do not think that you are wise. Instead, reverently fear Yahweh and refuse to do what is evil.

title: Proverbs 3:8
content: 8 Doing so will make your body healthy. Indeed, {doing so} will refresh you.

title: Proverbs 3:9
content: 9 Revere Yahweh {by giving to him} some of your riches, {even by giving to him} some of the first {crops} from everything that you harvest.

title: Proverbs 3:10
content: 10 {Doing so} will result in your places for storing crops becoming abundantly full {of crops}. Even your containers for wine will overflow with fresh wine.

title: Proverbs 3:11
content: 11 My child, do not refuse to listen when Yahweh corrects you. Do not be resentful even when he rebukes you.

title: Proverbs 3:12
content: 12 {Do not do so} because Yahweh only reproves the people whom he loves. He is similar to a father who reproves the child whom he likes.

title: Proverbs 3:13
content: 13 People who gain what is wise are happy. Indeed, people who gain what they should understand {are truly happy}.

title: Proverbs 3:14
content: 14 {This is} because being wise profits people more than silver {could profit them}. Indeed, being wise benefits people more than gold {could benefit them}.

title: Proverbs 3:15
content: 15 Being wise is more valuable than precious jewels. There is nothing you could desire that is worth as much as being wise.

title: Proverbs 3:16
content: 16 Being wise will help you live for a long time. Being wise will help you become wealthy and honorable.

title: Proverbs 3:17
content: 17 Being wise will make you live pleasantly. Indeed, in every way being wise will make you live peacefully.

title: Proverbs 3:18
content: 18 What is wise is {like} a tree {with fruit} that keeps alive the people who hold on to it, People who are consistently wise live happily.

title: Proverbs 3:19
content: 19 Yahweh made the world by using what is wise. He made the sky by using what he understands.

title: Proverbs 3:20
content: 20 According to what Yahweh understands, water flowed forth from deep {below the earth} and water fell from the clouds {above}.

title: Proverbs 3:21
content: 21 My child, always remember to do what is prudent and discreet. Always be mindful to do those things.

title: Proverbs 3:22
content: 22 Doing so will help you live for a long time and will make you {respectable, as if you had} an attractive necklace around your neck.

title: Proverbs 3:23
content: 23 Doing so will {also} cause you to live safely. You will not even get hurt.

title: Proverbs 3:24
content: 24 When you lie down {to sleep}, you will not fear anything. You will even lie down {to sleep} and sleep peacefully.

title: Proverbs 3:25
content: 25 Do not worry about something terrible suddenly happening {to you}, or about {what will happen} when God destroys wicked people.

title: Proverbs 3:26
content: 26 {Do not worry} because Yahweh will make you confident. He will not allow people to harm you.

title: Proverbs 3:27
content: 27 Do not refrain from giving what is good to people who deserve it when you are able to do so.

title: Proverbs 3:28
content: 28 When you have something {that someone you know needs}, do not tell that person, “Go away and come back later. I will give it to you then.”

title: Proverbs 3:29
content: 29 Do not plan to harm anyone, even someone who lives nearby and trusts you.

title: Proverbs 3:30
content: 30 Do not argue needlessly with someone who has not harmed you.

title: Proverbs 3:31
content: 31 Do not envy violent people. Do not imitate anything they do.

title: Proverbs 3:32
content: 32 {Do not do so} because Yahweh detests {such} people who act wickedly, but he converses like a friend with people who act uprightly.

title: Proverbs 3:33
content: 33 Yahweh causes bad things to happen to the families of wicked people, but he causes good things to happen to the families of righteous people.

title: Proverbs 3:34
content: 34 Yahweh is the one who ridicules people who ridicule {others}, but he approves of people who are humble.

title: Proverbs 3:35
content: 35 People will honor wise people, but will shame foolish people.

title: Proverbs 4:1
content: 1 Children, listen carefully to what I, your father, am teaching you. Pay attention in order to learn what you should understand.

title: Proverbs 4:2
content: 2 {Do this} because what I am teaching you is good. {So} remember the rules that I am teaching you.

title: Proverbs 4:3
content: 3 I was once my father’s boy, {and} my mother considered me to be her delicate, only son.

title: Proverbs 4:4
content: 4 During that time, my father taught me. He told me, “Remember what I have told you! Do what I have commanded you, so that you will keep on living!

title: Proverbs 4:5
content: 5 Obtain what is wise and what you should understand! Always remember what I have spoken to you!

title: Proverbs 4:6
content: 6 Remember what is wise, so that it will be like a woman who keeps you safe. Love what is wise, so that it will be like a woman who protects you.

title: Proverbs 4:7
content: 7 Being wise is the most important thing! {So} obtain what is wise! {Even if} it costs you everything that you own, obtain what you should understand!

title: Proverbs 4:8
content: 8 Prize what is wise, so that you will become great. People will honor you when you value what is wise.

title: Proverbs 4:9
content: 9 Being wise {will make you respectable, as if it} put an attractive wreath on your head. Indeed, being wise {will make you honorable, as if it} gave you a magnificent crown.”

title: Proverbs 4:10
content: 10 My child, listen attentively and accept what I say. Doing so will increase the number of years that you live.

title: Proverbs 4:11
content: 11 I instructed you in how to act wisely. I directed you in how to act uprightly.

title: Proverbs 4:12
content: 12 When you do something, nothing will prevent you {from succeeding}. Indeed, if you do anything, you will succeed.

title: Proverbs 4:13
content: 13 Consistently remember the things I have instructed you; keep remembering them! Always be mindful of them, because they will keep you alive.

title: Proverbs 4:14
content: 14 Do not do what wicked people do. Indeed, do not act like evil people act.

title: Proverbs 4:15
content: 15 Shun doing what is evil. Do not even consider doing it! Refuse to act wickedly and do something else.

title: Proverbs 4:16
content: 16 {Do not act wickedly} because {it is as if} evil people cannot even sleep unless they do something evil; {it is as if} they cannot rest unless they hurt someone.

title: Proverbs 4:17
content: 17 {Do not act wickedly} because evil people do wicked things as if they were eating food; they violently hurt others as if they were drinking wine.

title: Proverbs 4:18
content: 18 As for righteous people, {they will live wisely and safely} like the light of the sun at dawn. {They will live more and more wisely and safely as} the sun shines brighter and brighter until the brightest time of day.

title: Proverbs 4:19
content: 19 {But} wicked people {live dangerously} like people {who walk} in total darkness. {Like people walking in darkness do not know} what they trip over, they do not know {what hurts them}.

title: Proverbs 4:20
content: 20 My child, pay attention to what I am saying to you! Listen carefully to what I say!

title: Proverbs 4:21
content: 21 Always remember what I say! Fully commit yourself to remembering such things!

title: Proverbs 4:22
content: 22 {Do this} because those who do so will live {for a long time}, even their whole bodies will be healthy.

title: Proverbs 4:23
content: 23 Be extremely careful about what you think, because what you think will control how you live.

title: Proverbs 4:24
content: 24 Do not say anything that deceives people. Indeed, never say anything that misleads people.

title: Proverbs 4:25
content: 25 {Focus on doing what is right, like} someone who is always looking straight ahead. Indeed, {act like} someone who is looking straight in front of himself.

title: Proverbs 4:26
content: 26 Carefully consider what you do. As a result {of doing so}, you will succeed in everything that you do.

title: Proverbs 4:27
content: 27 Do not do anything other than what is right. Prevent yourself from doing what is evil.

title: Proverbs 5:1
content: 1 My son, pay attention to the wise things that I tell you! Listen carefully to what I say you should understand!

title: Proverbs 5:2
content: 2 {Do this} so that you may remain discreet, and you may preserve what you know when you speak.

title: Proverbs 5:3
content: 3 {Do this} because what adulterous women say seems delightful like honey and more pleasing than olive oil.

title: Proverbs 5:4
content: 4 However, being with such a woman will result in you being miserable, as if you had eaten a bitter plant. {You will suffer} like a person whom someone has cut with a sharp, double-edged sword.

title: Proverbs 5:5
content: 5 {Being with such a woman will result in both of you dying} as if she were leading you to where dead people are. Indeed, what she does will cause you both to die.

title: Proverbs 5:6
content: 6 She does not want to do what will cause her to live for a long time. She does not realize that she {lives precariously like someone who} is walking on an uneven path.

title: Proverbs 5:7
content: 7 So now, children, pay attention to what I say! Always remember what I have spoken to you!

title: Proverbs 5:8
content: 8 Stay far away from any adulterous woman! Do not even go near the door of the place where such a woman dwells!

title: Proverbs 5:9
content: 9 If you go to such a woman, people will weaken you, and some merciless person will take away {what you have gained in} the best time of your life.

title: Proverbs 5:10
content: 10 If you go to such a woman, people you do not know will satisfy themselves with {what you gained} when you were strong, and some foreign person will fill his house with what you labored to gain.

title: Proverbs 5:11
content: 11 Then you will groan when you are about to die and have worn out your whole body.

title: Proverbs 5:12
content: 12 Then you will say, “I hated it extremely when people corrected me! Indeed, I scorned people when they rebuked me!

title: Proverbs 5:13
content: 13 I did not obey the people who taught me. Indeed, I did not listen carefully to the people who instructed me.

title: Proverbs 5:14
content: 14 I almost utterly disgraced myself in public.”

title: Proverbs 5:15
content: 15 {So be like} someone who only drinks water from his own well; have sex with your wife only.

title: Proverbs 5:16
content: 16 {Do not be like} someone who lets his water run out into the streets; never have sex with other women!

title: Proverbs 5:17
content: 17 Only have sex with your own wife! Do not have sex with other women!

title: Proverbs 5:18
content: 18 Be happy with your wife; rejoice with the woman whom you married when you were young.

title: Proverbs 5:19
content: 19 {She is as beautiful as} a loving deer and {as graceful as} a mountain goat. Let how attractive she is always satisfy you. Constantly be exhilarated by how she loves you.

title: Proverbs 5:20
content: 20 My son, you should never be exhilarated by an adulterous woman! You should never passionately caress an immoral woman!

title: Proverbs 5:21
content: 21 {Never do that] because Yahweh fully knows what people do. Indeed, he knows everything that people do.

title: Proverbs 5:22
content: 22 The wicked things that wicked people do are {like} traps that catch them; the sinful things they do are {like] ropes that tie them down.

title: Proverbs 5:23
content: 23 Those wicked people will die because they did not discipline themselves. They will do what kills them because they are extremely foolish.

title: Proverbs 6:1
content: 1 My child, if you guarantee to pay a loan for someone you know, {or if} you agree to pay a loan for someone you do not know,

title: Proverbs 6:2
content: 2 {or if} you have troubled yourself by promising to do something, {and} you cannot fulfill what you promised,

title: Proverbs 6:3
content: 3 then, my child, do this in order to save yourself {from what you have troubled yourself with}: humbly go to that person you know and beg him {to cancel what you have promised} because he controls you.

title: Proverbs 6:4
content: 4 Do not sleep, do not even rest {until you go and talk to him}.

title: Proverbs 6:5
content: 5 Save yourself {immediately}, as if you were a deer fleeing from a hunter or a bird fleeing from a trapper.

title: Proverbs 6:6
content: 6 You lazy person, go watch ants! Consider what ants do so that you can be wise.

title: Proverbs 6:7
content: 7 Absolutely no one tells ants what to do.

title: Proverbs 6:8
content: 8 {Nevertheless,} at the right time they store their food {to eat during the winter}. Indeed, when people harvest crops, the ants collect what they will {later} eat.

title: Proverbs 6:9
content: 9 {But} you lazy person, stop sleeping! Wake up!

title: Proverbs 6:10
content: 10 {You say to yourself,} “Let me sleep just a little more! Let me lay my hands {across my chest} in order to rest comfortably for a little while longer!”

title: Proverbs 6:11
content: 11 {Being so lazy} will result in you suddenly becoming poor and needy as if a thief has robbed you.

title: Proverbs 6:12
content: 12 Worthless people who act sinfully constantly deceive people by what they say.

title: Proverbs 6:13
content: 13 They gesture with their bodies to deceive people.

title: Proverbs 6:14
content: 14 They are always thinking perversely while planning how to do evil things. They cause people to argue {with each other}.

title: Proverbs 6:15
content: 15 Because of this, disastrous things will suddenly happen to those people. Someone will destroy them instantly and they will not be able to recover.

title: Proverbs 6:16
content: 16 Yahweh absolutely hates six, no, seven things:

title: Proverbs 6:17
content: 17 being proud, speaking falsely, someone who murders a person who has not done anything wrong,

title: Proverbs 6:18
content: 18 someone who plans ways to act sinfully, someone who is eager to act wickedly,

title: Proverbs 6:19
content: 19 someone who easily lies when testifying, and someone who causes members of the same family to argue.

title: Proverbs 6:20
content: 20 My child, be mindful to obey what I, your father, have commanded {you}. Indeed, obey the rules that your mother has commanded.

title: Proverbs 6:21
content: 21 Remember what we have taught you as if it were always a part of you. Indeed, {remember these lessons as if} you wore them like a necklace.

title: Proverbs 6:22
content: 22 What we have taught you will cause you to know what you should do each day. It will cause you to be safe when you sleep. It will even be instructive for you when you wake up {in the morning}.

title: Proverbs 6:23
content: 23 {This is so} because what I have commanded {you} is {like} a lamp {for you}. Indeed, the rules {we taught you} are {like} a light {to guide you}. When we rebuke you while instructing you, {we do that} so that you can do what will keep you alive.

title: Proverbs 6:24
content: 24 {We taught you these lessons} in order to prevent you from {going to} wicked women, {and to prevent you} from {believing} what immoral women say seductively.

title: Proverbs 6:25
content: 25 Do not think lustfully about her beautiful body. Do not let her seduce you by the {flirtatious} way she looks at you.

title: Proverbs 6:26
content: 26 {Do not do so} because, although having sex with a prostitute only costs you the price of a cheap meal, an {adulterous} married woman will cause you to die.

title: Proverbs 6:27
content: 27 Fire will surely burn people who put it on their chests!

title: Proverbs 6:28
content: 28 Burning coals will surely burn the feet of people who step on them!

title: Proverbs 6:29
content: 29 It is similar with anyone who acts adulterously with a married woman. People will certainly punish anyone who does that.

title: Proverbs 6:30
content: 30 Nobody hates people who steal if they steal {food} in order to feed themselves when they are hungry.

title: Proverbs 6:31
content: 31 Nevertheless, if people catch thieves, those thieves must pay back seven times {as much as they stole to those whom they stole from}. They must give everything that they have {in order to repay what they stole}.

title: Proverbs 6:32
content: 32 By contrast, a man who acts adulterously with a woman does not think wisely. What he does will kill him!

title: Proverbs 6:33
content: 33 Someone will injure and disgrace him, and he will always be ashamed.

title: Proverbs 6:34
content: 34 {This is so} because the jealous husband will become furious. He will act mercilessly when he revenges himself {on the man who acted adulterously with his wife}.

title: Proverbs 6:35
content: 35 That jealous husband will not accept any money {to stop being furious}, no matter how much money you offer him.

title: Proverbs 7:1
content: 1 My son, obey what I have told you. Sincerely consider what I have commanded {you} to be precious.

title: Proverbs 7:2
content: 2 Do what I have commanded {you}, so that you will keep on living. Consider the rules I have taught you to be the most precious things you possess.

title: Proverbs 7:3
content: 3 {Always remember what I have commanded you as if} it were tied around your fingers. Remember it at all times!

title: Proverbs 7:4
content: 4 Love what is wise as if it were your sister. Indeed, love what you should understand as if it were a close relative.

title: Proverbs 7:5
content: 5 {Do this} so that you will be able to stay away from adulterous women, and {stay away} from immoral women who speak {to you} seductively.

title: Proverbs 7:6
content: 6 {I was} once {standing} near the window {in my house}, and I looked down {from above the street} through the shutters on the window.

title: Proverbs 7:7
content: 7 Then I observed {someone} among the naive people. I noticed among the youths a young man who does not think wisely.

title: Proverbs 7:8
content: 8 He walked down the street near the corner of {the road where} the adulterous woman {dwells}. Then he walked toward the place where she dwelled.

title: Proverbs 7:9
content: 9 (It was the time of day when night begins, {and then} it became dark.)

title: Proverbs 7:10
content: 10 Suddenly an adulterous woman approached the young man. She was wearing a prostitute’s clothing and intended to deceive {the young man}.

title: Proverbs 7:11
content: 11 (That woman spoke loudly and acted rebelliously. She never stayed at home.

title: Proverbs 7:12
content: 12 She {often} walked around the streets and public places. At the corner of any road she waited for someone whom she could seduce.)

title: Proverbs 7:13
content: 13 When {she saw the young man}, she firmly took hold of him and kissed him. She shamelessly told {him},

title: Proverbs 7:14
content: 14 “Today {I have meat in my house, because} I sacrificed an animal {in the temple} to promise friendship {with Yahweh}. {In this way} I did what I had vowed to do.

title: Proverbs 7:15
content: 15 So I have come out here to meet you. {I have come out} to look everywhere for you, and now I have found you!

title: Proverbs 7:16
content: 16 I have covered my bed with expensive Egyptian fabric.

title: Proverbs 7:17
content: 17 I have put pleasant-smelling perfumes on my bed: myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

title: Proverbs 7:18
content: 18 Come {with me}! Let us satisfy ourselves sexually all night! Let us enjoy ourselves sexually!

title: Proverbs 7:19
content: 19 {Come with me} because my husband is not at home. He has gone away on a long journey.

title: Proverbs 7:20
content: 20 He filled a bag with money and took it with him. He will not return home until the middle of the month.”

title: Proverbs 7:21
content: 21 {Thus} that adulterous woman persuaded the young man by speaking so persuasively; by speaking seductively she allured him {into doing what she wanted to do}.

title: Proverbs 7:22
content: 22 He quickly followed her {to her home}. He {unknowingly} went to die like an ox going to the place where its owner will kill it. {He went to die} like a foolish person {who goes} in fetters to be punished

title: Proverbs 7:23
content: 23 until {someone kills him by} shooting an arrow into his entrails. {He went to die quickly} like a bird that flies into a trap. He did not realize that going with the adulterous woman would cause him to die.

title: Proverbs 7:24
content: 24 So now, children, pay attention to what I say! Pay careful attention to what I have spoken to you!

title: Proverbs 7:25
content: 25 Do not decide to do what adulterous women do. Indeed, never act like them!

title: Proverbs 7:26
content: 26 {Do not do so} because they have killed many men who are {now} slain. They have slain so many men!

title: Proverbs 7:27
content: 27 {Going to} an adulterous woman’s house is doing something that will result in that person dying. {Doing that} will result in that person going to the place where the spirits of dead people are.

title: Proverbs 8:1
content: 1 What is wise {is surely like a woman who} calls out {to everyone}. Indeed, what people should understand {is surely like a woman who} shouts {to people}.

title: Proverbs 8:2
content: 2 What is wise {is like a woman who} stands at the highest place along the crowded streets {where everyone can hear her}.

title: Proverbs 8:3
content: 3 What is wise {is like a woman who} cries out next to the gates at the entrance to a city.

title: Proverbs 8:4
content: 4 {She proclaims:} “I am calling out to all of you! I am speaking to all people!

title: Proverbs 8:5
content: 5 You naive people must comprehend what is prudent. You foolish people comprehend how to be discerning.

title: Proverbs 8:6
content: 6 Listen {to what I say}, because I will tell you some excellent things. I will speak to you about what is right.

title: Proverbs 8:7
content: 7 {Listen to what I say} because I speak what is true. I detest speaking what is evil.

title: Proverbs 8:8
content: 8 Everything that I say is righteous. I do not say anything that is false or deceptive.

title: Proverbs 8:9
content: 9 Everything that I say is plain for people who understand. {Everything that I say} is right to people who have become knowledgeable.

title: Proverbs 8:10
content: 10 Choose {to learn} what I instruct you instead of silver. Indeed, {choose to learn} what you should know instead of the finest gold.

title: Proverbs 8:11
content: 11 {Do this} because I am more valuable than precious jewels. I am more valuable than anything you can desire.

title: Proverbs 8:12
content: 12 I am what is wise. I am related to what is prudent. I enable someone to know what is discreet.

title: Proverbs 8:13
content: 13 Everyone who reverently fears Yahweh hates what is evil. {I hate it when} people are proud or arrogant. I hate it when people act wickedly and when people speak perversely.

title: Proverbs 8:14
content: 14 I advise people and enable them to be truly wise. I am what you need to understand. I strengthen people.

title: Proverbs 8:15
content: 15 I enable kings to rule {well}. {I enable} rulers to make righteous laws.

title: Proverbs 8:16
content: 16 I enable princes to govern; and {I enable} every royal official who judges righteously {to govern}.

title: Proverbs 8:17
content: 17 I {am what is wise, and} I benefit anyone who loves me. Anyone who earnestly tries to become wise will succeed.

title: Proverbs 8:18
content: 18 I enable people to become rich and I cause people to honor those people. {I enable people to have} riches that will last and {I enable people to become} righteous.

title: Proverbs 8:19
content: 19 What I can give people is more valuable than even the purest gold and the best silver.

title: Proverbs 8:20
content: 20 I {always} do what is righteous and just

title: Proverbs 8:21
content: 21 in order to give wealth to people who love me. I will fill up the places where they store valuable items.

title: Proverbs 8:22
content: 22 Yahweh had me{, what is wise,} when he began to create {everything}. {Indeed, he had me} before he started doing that.

title: Proverbs 8:23
content: 23 Yahweh established me a very long time ago—at the very beginning, before the world existed.

title: Proverbs 8:24
content: 24 I began to exist before the oceans existed and before there were springs abounding with water.

title: Proverbs 8:25
content: 25 I began to exist before Yahweh made the mountains {and} before the hills {existed}.

title: Proverbs 8:26
content: 26 {I began to exist} before Yahweh made the land or the fields or the first particles of dirt on the earth.

title: Proverbs 8:27
content: 27 I existed when Yahweh made the sky, {and} when he made the boundary between the sky and the ocean’s surface.

title: Proverbs 8:28
content: 28 {I existed} when Yahweh made the clouds above {the earth}, {and} when he made the springs flow at the bottom of the ocean.

title: Proverbs 8:29
content: 29 {I existed} when Yahweh set boundaries for the seas, so that the water {in the seas} would not go past those boundaries. {I existed} when Yahweh made the boundaries of the land.

title: Proverbs 8:30
content: 30 At that time I was {like} someone who was beside Yahweh {and} helped him create {everything}. I made him happy every day. I was always rejoicing when I was with him.

title: Proverbs 8:31
content: 31 {I was} rejoicing in the whole world that Yahweh had made. I was also happy with the people {he had made}.

title: Proverbs 8:32
content: 32 So now, children, pay attention to what I say! {Do this} because anyone who behaves wisely will be happy.

title: Proverbs 8:33
content: 33 Listen to what I teach {you}, so that you will become wise. Accept what I teach you!

title: Proverbs 8:34
content: 34 People who listen to me will be happy, {They are eager to listen to me like} people who wait {for me} at the door of my house every day. {They are like} people who diligently wait {for me} at my doorway.

title: Proverbs 8:35
content: 35 {This is true} because people who learn to be wise will live {a long time}, and Yahweh will approve of them.

title: Proverbs 8:36
content: 36 But those who refuse to be wise hurt themselves. All those who hate to be wise {are like people who} love death.”

title: Proverbs 9:1
content: 1 What is wise {is like a woman who} has built her own {spacious} house and made seven pillars to support its roof.

title: Proverbs 9:2
content: 2 {What is wise is like} a woman {who has prepared a meal for guests. She} has prepared the meat {to eat} and wine {to drink}. She has {fully} prepared her table for a meal.

title: Proverbs 9:3
content: 3 {What is wise is like} a woman who sends out her maids {to invite her dinner guests}. {What is wise is like} a woman who cries out at the highest place in the city {where everyone can hear her}.

title: Proverbs 9:4
content: 4 She tells those who are not wise, “Come into {my house}, all you naive people!

title: Proverbs 9:5
content: 5 Come {to me}! Eat the food that I have prepared, and drink the wine that I have prepared.

title: Proverbs 9:6
content: 6 Stop acting naively so that you can live {for a long time}. Do what will cause you to learn what you should understand.

title: Proverbs 9:7
content: 7 If you {try to} teach someone who ridicules {other people}, that person will ridicule you. If you correct an evil person, that person will hurt you.

title: Proverbs 9:8
content: 8 {So} do not correct a person who ridicules {other people}. If you do so, then that person will hate you. {However,} if you correct a wise person, that person will love you {for doing so}.

title: Proverbs 9:9
content: 9 If you instruct a wise person, then that person will become even wiser. If you teach a righteous person, then that person will learn even more.

title: Proverbs 9:10
content: 10 Reverently fearing Yahweh is necessary for being wise, and knowing what is holy is what you should understand.

title: Proverbs 9:11
content: 11 Surely being wise will cause you to live for many days, and it will cause you to live for many years.

title: Proverbs 9:12
content: 12 Any wise person benefits from being wise. But anyone who ridicules {other people} will suffer alone for doing so.”

title: Proverbs 9:13
content: 13 Foolish women speak loudly, act naively, and are very ignorant.

title: Proverbs 9:14
content: 14 They sit at the doors of the places where they dwell. {They sit} on seats at the highest place in the city {where everyone can hear them}.

title: Proverbs 9:15
content: 15 {They sit there} in order to cry out to the people who are walking past them. {They cry out to} those walking down the road, who are only concerned about where they are going.

title: Proverbs 9:16
content: 16 They tell those who are not wise, “Come into {my house}, all you naive people!

title: Proverbs 9:17
content: 17 {Come to me, because having sex with someone to whom you are not married is} as sweet as water that you have stolen. Indeed, {it is} as delicious as food that you eat all by yourself.”

title: Proverbs 9:18
content: 18 But men who go to the houses of such women are not aware that the men who have gone there before have died. {They are not aware} that the guests of such women are now in the deepest parts of the place where dead people are.

title: Proverbs 10:1
content: 1 {These are} the wise sayings {said} by Solomon: Wise children make their fathers glad, but foolish children make their mothers sad.

title: Proverbs 10:2
content: 2 Riches that people acquire by acting wickedly will not benefit them, but people who act righteously prevent themselves from dying {too soon}.

title: Proverbs 10:3
content: 3 Yahweh prevents righteous people from starving, but he prevents wicked people from getting what they want.

title: Proverbs 10:4
content: 4 People who are too lazy to work become poor, but people who work hard become rich.

title: Proverbs 10:5
content: 5 Sons who collect crops at the right time are insightful, but sons who sleep during the time to harvest crops are shameful.

title: Proverbs 10:6
content: 6 God blesses righteous people; but what wicked people say prevents others from knowing about the violent acts {that they do}.

title: Proverbs 10:7
content: 7 People will be happy when they remember righteous people, but people will forget wicked people as if they were something that decays {and disappears}.

title: Proverbs 10:8
content: 8 People who think wisely obey what people command {them to do that is good}, but people who speak foolishly destroy themselves.

title: Proverbs 10:9
content: 9 People who behave honestly will live safely; but God will catch people who behave deceitfully.

title: Proverbs 10:10
content: 10 People who gesture with their eyes {to deceive people} hurt {people}, and people who speak foolishly destroy themselves.

title: Proverbs 10:11
content: 11 What righteous people say is like a spring that enables people to live for a long time; but what wicked people say prevents others from knowing about the violent acts {that they do}.

title: Proverbs 10:12
content: 12 When people are hateful, they cause people to argue; but when people are loving, they forgive people who wrong them.

title: Proverbs 10:13
content: 13 Discerning people say what is wise, but someone must punish people who do not think wisely.

title: Proverbs 10:14
content: 14 Wise people sincerely consider what they should know, but people who speak foolishly are destructive.

title: Proverbs 10:15
content: 15 What rich people own keeps them safe like a wall keeps a city safe, but being poor destroys poor people.

title: Proverbs 10:16
content: 16 God rewards righteous people by allowing them to live {for a long time}, but God recompenses wicked people by punishing them for sinning.

title: Proverbs 10:17
content: 17 People who heed what is instructive will live for a long time; but people who do not let others correct them do what will destroy them.

title: Proverbs 10:18
content: 18 People who do not admit that they hate someone speak falsely. People who slander others are foolish.

title: Proverbs 10:19
content: 19 People who talk a lot sin a lot; but people who refrain from speaking {unnecessarily} are wise.

title: Proverbs 10:20
content: 20 What righteous people say is {as valuable as} the best silver; {but} what wicked people think is worthless.

title: Proverbs 10:21
content: 21 What righteous people say benefits many people, but foolish people die because they do not think wisely.

title: Proverbs 10:22
content: 22 When people become wealthy, {it is because} Yahweh has blessed them, and he does not make them suffer for it.

title: Proverbs 10:23
content: 23 Foolish people enjoy doing the wicked things that they planned {to do}, but understanding people enjoy what is wise.

title: Proverbs 10:24
content: 24 Wicked people will experience what frightens them; but righteous people will receive what they want.

title: Proverbs 10:25
content: 25 When something disastrous happens, it destroys wicked people, but righteous people are {like} a foundation that lasts forever.

title: Proverbs 10:26
content: 26 Lazy people irritate people who send them {to do something for them}, like vinegar irritates teeth and smoke irritates eyes.

title: Proverbs 10:27
content: 27 Reverently fearing Yahweh will cause a person to live for a long time, but wicked people will not live for a long time.

title: Proverbs 10:28
content: 28 What righteous people hope for leads to being joyful, but what wicked people hope for will not happen.

title: Proverbs 10:29
content: 29 What Yahweh does protects honest people like a fortress, but what he does destroys people who act sinfully.

title: Proverbs 10:30
content: 30 Righteous people will always be safe, but wicked people will never live in our land.

title: Proverbs 10:31
content: 31 Righteous people say what is wise, but Yahweh will stop people who speak perversely from speaking.

title: Proverbs 10:32
content: 32 What righteous people say is favorable, but what wicked people say is perverse.

title: Proverbs 11:1
content: 1 Yahweh detests {people} using weighing instruments in order to deceive others, but people who use correct weights {on their weighing instruments} please him.

title: Proverbs 11:2
content: 2 When people act proudly, they will soon disgrace themselves, but humble people are wise.

title: Proverbs 11:3
content: 3 Being honest will cause people who act uprightly to know what they should do, but being deceitful will ruin people who act treacherously.

title: Proverbs 11:4
content: 4 What people own will not help them when Yahweh judges {the world}, but acting righteously will prevent people from dying.

title: Proverbs 11:5
content: 5 Being righteous will cause people whom Yahweh does not blame {for acting wickedly} to know what they should do, but being wicked will ruin those who act wickedly.

title: Proverbs 11:6
content: 6 Being righteous will cause people who act uprightly to escape, but what people who act treacherously want will cause someone to trap them.

title: Proverbs 11:7
content: 7 When wicked people die, what they hoped for never happens, what people who rely on how strong they are hoped for also never happens.

title: Proverbs 11:8
content: 8 Yahweh prevents righteous people from becoming distressed; but wicked people will become distressed instead.

title: Proverbs 11:9
content: 9 What people who reject God say ruins people they know, but what righteous people know will cause them to escape.

title: Proverbs 11:10
content: 10 People in a city rejoice when the righteous people {there} prosper, and they shout joyously when wicked people die.

title: Proverbs 11:11
content: 11 A city becomes great when people who act uprightly bless {the people there}, but what people who act wickedly say destroys that city.

title: Proverbs 11:12
content: 12 People who {openly} detest someone they know are not thinking wisely; but understanding people say nothing.

title: Proverbs 11:13
content: 13 People who gossip walk around telling {others} what is secret, but trustworthy people will not do so.

title: Proverbs 11:14
content: 14 Not having anyone to guide a people group will ruin that group, but having many people advise {a people group} will rescue {that group}.

title: Proverbs 11:15
content: 15 People who guarantee to pay a loan for someone they do not know will surely suffer, but people who hate agreeing to pay a loan for someone will be safe.

title: Proverbs 11:16
content: 16 People honor a gracious woman, but cruel people {only} gain wealth.

title: Proverbs 11:17
content: 17 People who are faithfully kind benefit themselves, but cruel people hurt themselves.

title: Proverbs 11:18
content: 18 People who act wickedly do not really gain anything, but God truly rewards people who do what is righteous.

title: Proverbs 11:19
content: 19 People who truly act righteously will live {for a long time}, but people who eagerly do what is evil will die.

title: Proverbs 11:20
content: 20 Yahweh detests people who think deceitfully, but people who act blamelessly please him.

title: Proverbs 11:21
content: 21 Yahweh will certainly punish wicked people. but he will not punish the offspring of righteous people.

title: Proverbs 11:22
content: 22 Attractive women who refuse to act discreetly are {as ridiculous as} a gold ring in a pig’s snout.

title: Proverbs 11:23
content: 23 What righteous people want only results in what is good, but what wicked people hope for results in {Yahweh} being angry.

title: Proverbs 11:24
content: 24 People who generously share {what they have with others} will receive even more, but people who keep more {of what they have} than they should keep will only lose it.

title: Proverbs 11:25
content: 25 People who generously bless others will prosper; and people who generously give others something to drink will also receive something to drink.

title: Proverbs 11:26
content: 26 People will curse people who {selfishly} hoard food {instead of selling it}, but they will bless people who sell it {when others need it}.

title: Proverbs 11:27
content: 27 Yahweh and others approve of people who earnestly try to do what is good, but evil things happen to people who try to do what is evil.

title: Proverbs 11:28
content: 28 People who depend on their money are those who will ruin themselves, but righteous people will thrive like a green plant.

title: Proverbs 11:29
content: 29 People who trouble their families will not inherit anything, and people who act foolishly will serve people who think wisely.

title: Proverbs 11:30
content: 30 What righteous people do is {like} a tree {with fruit} that keeps people alive, and people who persuade others are wise.

title: Proverbs 11:31
content: 31 Pay attention! Righteous people on the earth will get what they deserve; but even more so, wicked people and sinful people will {also} get what they deserve!

title: Proverbs 12:1
content: 1 People who love other people correcting them {also} love {learning} what they should know. But people who hate other people correcting them are foolish.

title: Proverbs 12:2
content: 2 Yahweh approves of people who are good, but he condemns people who plan to do what is evil.

title: Proverbs 12:3
content: 3 People cannot live stably by acting wickedly, but righteous people are {as stable as} a tree with immovable roots.

title: Proverbs 12:4
content: 4 A virtuous wife causes people to praise her husband, but a disgraceful wife {destroys her husband} like a disease that destroys his bones.

title: Proverbs 12:5
content: 5 What righteous people plan is just, {but} what wicked people advise is deceitful.

title: Proverbs 12:6
content: 6 What wicked people say {causes people to die like} someone who hides in wait in order to kill someone {who walks by}; but what upright people say will enable them to escape.

title: Proverbs 12:7
content: 7 Yahweh destroys wicked people and they will cease to exist, but the families of righteous people will continue to exist.

title: Proverbs 12:8
content: 8 People will praise someone according to how insightful that person is, but people will despise someone who thinks perversely.

title: Proverbs 12:9
content: 9 People whom others disrespect yet have servants are better than people who think they are important yet have no food.

title: Proverbs 12:10
content: 10 Righteous people take care of their animals, but even when wicked people {try to} act compassionately, they act cruelly.

title: Proverbs 12:11
content: 11 People who work hard will have enough food {to eat}, but people who waste time doing worthless things do not think wisely.

title: Proverbs 12:12
content: 12 Wicked people want what evil people steal, but righteous people benefit {others} like a tree with deep roots.

title: Proverbs 12:13
content: 13 What wicked people sinfully say will destroy them, but righteous people will not become distressed.

title: Proverbs 12:14
content: 14 What people say will satisfy them with what is good; what people work hard to accomplish will benefit them.

title: Proverbs 12:15
content: 15 Foolish people think that what they are doing is {always} right; but wise people listen to what other people advise {them to do}.

title: Proverbs 12:16
content: 16 People know immediately when foolish people are angry; but clever people ignore it when someone disrespects them.

title: Proverbs 12:17
content: 17 People who easily speak truthfully speak righteously, but witnesses who speak falsely speak deceitfully.

title: Proverbs 12:18
content: 18 When people speak without thinking {about what to say}, they hurt others like someone who stabs people with a sword, but what wise people say helps people heal.

title: Proverbs 12:19
content: 19 What people say truthfully will last forever, but what people say falsely will {only} last for a moment.

title: Proverbs 12:20
content: 20 People who plan to act evilly think deceitfully, but people who advise others to act peacefully will be joyful.

title: Proverbs 12:21
content: 21 Bad things do not happen to righteous people, but wicked people will experience many bad things.

title: Proverbs 12:22
content: 22 Yahweh detests people who speak falsely, but people who act faithfully please him.

title: Proverbs 12:23
content: 23 Clever people conceal what they know, but foolish people shout out foolish things.

title: Proverbs 12:24
content: 24 People who work hard will reign {over others}, but lazy people will become slaves.

title: Proverbs 12:25
content: 25 When people worry, they feel sad, but when someone says what is good, those people feel happy.

title: Proverbs 12:26
content: 26 Righteous people will guide the people they know, but what wicked people do causes them to do what will destroy them.

title: Proverbs 12:27
content: 27 Lazy people do not even cook the animals that they catch, but people who work hard acquire valuable riches.

title: Proverbs 12:28
content: 28 People who do what is righteous will live {for a long time}. Indeed, people who do so will not die {too soon}.

title: Proverbs 13:1
content: 1 Wise children pay attention when their fathers instruct them, but people who ridicule {other people} do not pay attention when people correct {them}.

title: Proverbs 13:2
content: 2 What people say will enable them to eat good {food}, but people who act treacherously {only} want to act violently.

title: Proverbs 13:3
content: 3 People who are careful about what they say enable themselves to stay alive, {but} people who speak carelessly destroy themselves.

title: Proverbs 13:4
content: 4 Lazy people always want something but never receive it, but people who work hard will receive more than what they want.

title: Proverbs 13:5
content: 5 Righteous people detest speaking falsely, but wicked people are disgusting and disgraceful.

title: Proverbs 13:6
content: 6 Acting righteously enables people who act blamelessly to be safe, but acting wickedly causes sinful people to do what will destroy them.

title: Proverbs 13:7
content: 7 Some people act as if they are wealthy while they are {actually} poor. Other people act as if they are poor while they are {actually} wealthy.

title: Proverbs 13:8
content: 8 Rich people {might} have to pay money {to someone who threatens them} in order to stay alive, but poor people do not {even} listen when someone threatens them.

title: Proverbs 13:9
content: 9 Righteous people live joyfully like a light {that shines brightly}, but wicked people {will merely die} like an oil lamp that stops burning {oil}.

title: Proverbs 13:10
content: 10 People acting proudly only causes people to argue, but people who let others advise them are wise.

title: Proverbs 13:11
content: 11 Riches that people gain effortlessly will diminish, but people who gain riches by working hard will increase {their riches}.

title: Proverbs 13:12
content: 12 People despair when they do not receive what they hope to receive, but receiving what people want to receive is {like} a tree {with fruit} that keeps those people alive.

title: Proverbs 13:13
content: 13 People who detest what others {try to} teach them will suffer for doing so, but God will reward those very people who reverently fear what he has commanded.

title: Proverbs 13:14
content: 14 What wise people teach is like a spring that enables people to live for a long time. It enables people to avoid what could kill them.

title: Proverbs 13:15
content: 15 People approve of people who are very insightful, but how treacherous people live is harsh.

title: Proverbs 13:16
content: 16 All clever people act according to what they know, but foolish people show how foolish they are {by how they act}.

title: Proverbs 13:17
content: 17 Bad things happen to messengers who are not reliable, but reliable messengers help people heal.

title: Proverbs 13:18
content: 18 People who do not let other people correct them will be poor and ashamed, but people will respect those people who let other people rebuke them.

title: Proverbs 13:19
content: 19 People feel pleasant when they get what they want, but foolish people detest refusing to do what is evil.

title: Proverbs 13:20
content: 20 People who associate with wise people will become wise {themselves}, but people who are companions of foolish people will agonize.

title: Proverbs 13:21
content: 21 Bad things happen to sinful people, but good things happen to righteous people.

title: Proverbs 13:22
content: 22 Good people will leave riches for their grandchildren when they die, but righteous people will receive the riches that sinful people have saved.

title: Proverbs 13:23
content: 23 Poor people have fields that can produce a lot of food, but unjust people take it all away {from them}.

title: Proverbs 13:24
content: 24 Parents who do not physically punish {their children act as if they} hate their children, but parents who {truly} love their children are careful to discipline them.

title: Proverbs 13:25
content: 25 Righteous people eat enough {food} to satisfy themselves, but wicked people are always hungry.

title: Proverbs 14:1
content: 1 The wisest women help their families thrive, but foolish women ruin their families by what they do.

title: Proverbs 14:2
content: 2 People who behave uprightly reverently fear Yahweh, but people who behave deceptively detest Yahweh.

title: Proverbs 14:3
content: 3 What foolish people say causes someone to punish them for being proud, but what wise people say keeps them alive.

title: Proverbs 14:4
content: 4 Where there are not any oxen {to feed in the barn}, the feeding container is clean; but oxen work to produce a lot of crops.

title: Proverbs 14:5
content: 5 Honest witnesses do not lie, but dishonest witnesses lie easily.

title: Proverbs 14:6
content: 6 People who ridicule {other people} try to become wise and fail to do so, but understanding people can easily learn what they should know.

title: Proverbs 14:7
content: 7 Stay away from foolish people because you will not learn anything from what they say.

title: Proverbs 14:8
content: 8 Clever people know what to do because they are wise, but foolish people deceive themselves because they are foolish.

title: Proverbs 14:9
content: 9 Foolish people scorn making amends with Yahweh after sinning, but Yahweh approves of upright people.

title: Proverbs 14:10
content: 10 Only miserable people know how miserable they are, and joyful people cannot share what they feel with someone they do not know.

title: Proverbs 14:11
content: 11 The families of wicked people will die out, but the families of upright people will thrive.

title: Proverbs 14:12
content: 12 People think they know the right way to behave, but people who behave that way will ultimately die.

title: Proverbs 14:13
content: 13 People who are laughing may still be suffering, and people who feel joyful may ultimately feel sad.

title: Proverbs 14:14
content: 14 People who refuse {to live righteously} will receive from Yahweh what they deserve; and good people {will also receive from Yahweh} what they deserve.

title: Proverbs 14:15
content: 15 Naive people believe whatever people say, but clever people think carefully about what they do.

title: Proverbs 14:16
content: 16 Wise people are afraid of {doing what is evil} and refuse to do what is evil, but foolish people make themselves angry and are overconfident.

title: Proverbs 14:17
content: 17 People who quickly become angry act foolishly, and people hate people who plan to do what is evil.

title: Proverbs 14:18
content: 18 Naive people will act foolishly, but clever people will learn what they should know.

title: Proverbs 14:19
content: 19 Evil people will {respectfully} bow in front of good people, and wicked people will bow at the doors {of the houses} where righteous people {dwell}.

title: Proverbs 14:20
content: 20 Even the people whom poor people know hate them, but many people love rich people.

title: Proverbs 14:21
content: 21 Sinful people scorn the people they know, but people who are kind to suffering people are happy.

title: Proverbs 14:22
content: 22 People who plan to act evilly surely act deceptively, but people are faithful and trustworthy to people who plan to do what is good.

title: Proverbs 14:23
content: 23 Whenever people work hard, they will earn money, but when people {only} talk, they will only remain poor.

title: Proverbs 14:24
content: 24 Wise people will acquire wealth, but foolish people {only} act more foolishly because they are foolish.

title: Proverbs 14:25
content: 25 Truthful witnesses save people from dying, but people who lie easily are deceptive.

title: Proverbs 14:26
content: 26 Strong people are confident because they reverently fear Yahweh. Those people will protect their children.

title: Proverbs 14:27
content: 27 Reverently fearing Yahweh is like a spring that enables people to live for a long time. It enables people to avoid what could kill them.

title: Proverbs 14:28
content: 28 Kings who rule over many people are glorious, but rulers who have no people {to rule over} have nothing.

title: Proverbs 14:29
content: 29 People who do not become angry quickly understand a lot, but people who become angry quickly show everyone how foolish they are.

title: Proverbs 14:30
content: 30 Feeling peaceful makes a person’s body healthy, but envying others {makes a person’s body unhealthy, like something that} rots a person’s bones.

title: Proverbs 14:31
content: 31 People who make poor people suffer despise Yahweh, who made them, but people who are kind to needy people respect Yahweh.

title: Proverbs 14:32
content: 32 Wicked people destroy themselves by doing evil things, but righteous people feel safe {even} when they die.

title: Proverbs 14:33
content: 33 Understanding people think wisely, and even foolish people know about what is wise.

title: Proverbs 14:34
content: 34 Acting righteously makes a country great, but acting sinfully disgraces a people group.

title: Proverbs 14:35
content: 35 Insightful servants please their kings, but kings are furious with disgraceful people.

title: Proverbs 15:1
content: 1 Replying gently to angry people will calm them, but speaking harshly {to them} will make them angrier.

title: Proverbs 15:2
content: 2 What wise people say makes others appreciate what they should know, but foolish people constantly say what is foolish.

title: Proverbs 15:3
content: 3 Yahweh sees everything that is happening; he observes both evil people and good people.

title: Proverbs 15:4
content: 4 What people say soothingly is {like} a tree {with fruit} that keeps people alive, but what people say deceitfully makes people despair.

title: Proverbs 15:5
content: 5 Foolish people detest what their fathers say to correct them, but people who let others rebuke them are clever.

title: Proverbs 15:6
content: 6 Righteous people have houses that contain a lot of riches, but what wicked people gain troubles them.

title: Proverbs 15:7
content: 7 What wise people say informs others of what they should know, but what foolish people think does not do that.

title: Proverbs 15:8
content: 8 Yahweh detests what wicked people offer {to him}, but what upright people pray pleases him.

title: Proverbs 15:9
content: 9 Yahweh detests what wicked people do, but he loves people who diligently try to act righteously.

title: Proverbs 15:10
content: 10 Yahweh will severely punish people who refuse to live righteously, {and} people who hate other people correcting them will perish.

title: Proverbs 15:11
content: 11 Yahweh knows everything about the place where dead people are, so he surely knows everything that everyone thinks!

title: Proverbs 15:12
content: 12 People who ridicule others despise anyone who corrects them; they avoid wise people.

title: Proverbs 15:13
content: 13 People smile when they are happy, but feeling sad can make people despair.

title: Proverbs 15:14
content: 14 Understanding people try to learn what they should know, but foolish people satisfy themselves with what is foolish.

title: Proverbs 15:15
content: 15 What happens every day that suffering people live makes them wretched, but cheerful people live like people who are always feasting.

title: Proverbs 15:16
content: 16 It is better for someone to have a few things while reverently fearing Yahweh than for someone to have a lot of riches while worrying.

title: Proverbs 15:17
content: 17 It is better for someone to have a small meal where people love each other than to have a large meal where people hate each other.

title: Proverbs 15:18
content: 18 People who easily become angry cause people to argue, but people who do not become angry quickly will stop people from arguing.

title: Proverbs 15:19
content: 19 Lazy people live unproductively like {people that have} a thorny plant {blocking their paths}, but upright people live productively {like people who are walking on} a road that is easy to walk on.

title: Proverbs 15:20
content: 20 Wise children make their fathers happy, but foolish children detest their mothers.

title: Proverbs 15:21
content: 21 People who are not wise enjoy acting foolishly, but understanding people act rightly.

title: Proverbs 15:22
content: 22 What people plan fails when no one advises them, but what people plan succeeds when many people advise them.

title: Proverbs 15:23
content: 23 People rejoice when they answer someone aptly. It is so good to say something at the right time!

title: Proverbs 15:24
content: 24 How insightful people live causes them to live for a long time in order for them to avoid going to the place where dead people are.

title: Proverbs 15:25
content: 25 Yahweh will destroy what proud people own, but he protects the {few} things that widows own.

title: Proverbs 15:26
content: 26 Yahweh detests the evil things that people think, but the pleasing things that people say are pure.

title: Proverbs 15:27
content: 27 People who gain wealth in an unjust manner trouble their families, but people who refuse bribes will live {for a long time}.

title: Proverbs 15:28
content: 28 Righteous people think carefully about how to reply to people, but wicked people constantly say what is evil.

title: Proverbs 15:29
content: 29 Yahweh does not listen to wicked people, but he listens to what righteous people pray.

title: Proverbs 15:30
content: 30 People feel happy when they see someone smile, {and} people feel healthy when they hear something good.

title: Proverbs 15:31
content: 31 People who listen when others rebuke them in a way that will keep them alive will become wise.

title: Proverbs 15:32
content: 32 People who refuse to let others correct them {act as if they} despise themselves, but people who listen when others rebuke them think wisely.

title: Proverbs 15:33
content: 33 Reverently fearing Yahweh makes people wise, and people must be humble before other people respect them.

title: Proverbs 16:1
content: 1 People plan what they want {to say}, but Yahweh determines how they will reply.

title: Proverbs 16:2
content: 2 People think that everything they do is right, but Yahweh {rightly} evaluates what they think.

title: Proverbs 16:3
content: 3 Entrust what you do to Yahweh, and he will make what you plan {to do} succeed.

title: Proverbs 16:4
content: 4 When Yahweh made everything, he planned what would happen to each thing. He has even made wicked people for the time when he will punish them.

title: Proverbs 16:5
content: 5 Yahweh detests all proud people; he will certainly punish them.

title: Proverbs 16:6
content: 6 People can atone for acting sinfully by being faithful and trustworthy. People who reverently fear Yahweh will avoid doing what is evil.

title: Proverbs 16:7
content: 7 When Yahweh likes what people do, he even causes their enemies to be peaceful with them.

title: Proverbs 16:8
content: 8 It is better {for someone} to have a few things while being righteous, than {for someone} to have a lot of crops while being unjust.

title: Proverbs 16:9
content: 9 People plan what they want to do, but Yahweh determines what they will {actually} do.

title: Proverbs 16:10
content: 10 {Ideally,} what kings say is from God, {and} when kings judge, they surely speak justly.

title: Proverbs 16:11
content: 11 Yahweh made weighing instruments {for us} to use honestly. Indeed, he made all the stones people carry in bags to use for weighing things.

title: Proverbs 16:12
content: 12 {Ideally,} kings detest people acting wickedly because acting righteously causes kings to rule securely.

title: Proverbs 16:13
content: 13 {Ideally,} kings enjoy when people speak righteously. Indeed, they love people who speak uprightly.

title: Proverbs 16:14
content: 14 When kings are angry, they cause people to die, so wise people will appease them.

title: Proverbs 16:15
content: 15 When kings are happy, they let people live; when they approve of people, it is as refreshing as rain in springtime.

title: Proverbs 16:16
content: 16 Becoming wise is better than having gold. Indeed, it is better to choose to become understanding than to have silver.

title: Proverbs 16:17
content: 17 Upright people act in a way that avoids doing what is evil; people who want to stay alive are careful about what they do.

title: Proverbs 16:18
content: 18 If people are proud, then something will destroy them. Indeed, if people are arrogant, then something will ruin them.

title: Proverbs 16:19
content: 19 It is better to live humbly among poor people than to {live proudly and} receive some of what proud people have taken from others.

title: Proverbs 16:20
content: 20 People who act prudently in a matter will succeed, and people who trust in Yahweh are happy.

title: Proverbs 16:21
content: 21 People will call those who think wisely, “understanding ones,” and pleasant things that people say cause others to learn.

title: Proverbs 16:22
content: 22 Being insightful is {like} a spring that enables insightful people to live for a long time, but being foolish results in other people punishing foolish people.

title: Proverbs 16:23
content: 23 What wise people think causes them to speak insightfully, and what those people say causes others to learn.

title: Proverbs 16:24
content: 24 The pleasing things that people say are {like} a honeycomb: They cause people to feel pleasant and healthy.

title: Proverbs 16:25
content: 25 People think they know the right way to behave, but people who behave that way will ultimately die.

title: Proverbs 16:26
content: 26 Being hungry helps working people work because wanting to eat motivates people to keep on working.

title: Proverbs 16:27
content: 27 Worthless people plot how to hurt others; the evil things they say harm others like fire burns {people}.

title: Proverbs 16:28
content: 28 Perverse people cause other people to argue with each other, and people who gossip about others cause friends to stop being friends.

title: Proverbs 16:29
content: 29 Violent people tempt people whom they know {to sin}, and they guide them to behave wickedly.

title: Proverbs 16:30
content: 30 People who use their eyes to signal to others are planning to do something perverse; people who use their lips to signal to others are about to do the evil thing {that they had planned to do}.

title: Proverbs 16:31
content: 31 Living for a long time is {honorable, like} a magnificent crown {on someone’s head}; people are able to live for a long time by living righteously.

title: Proverbs 16:32
content: 32 It is better to be someone who does not become angry quickly than to be powerful. It is better to control oneself than to be {as powerful as} someone who conquers a city.

title: Proverbs 16:33
content: 33 People throw lots {in order to decide what to do}, but Yahweh decides whatever happens.

title: Proverbs 17:1
content: 1 It is better for someone to have a little stale food {to eat} while living peacefully than for someone to live in a house where people frequently eat large meals while arguing with each other.

title: Proverbs 17:2
content: 2 An insightful slave will rule over his master’s disgraceful son. People will consider that slave to be one of his master’s sons, and he will inherit some of what his master’s sons inherit.

title: Proverbs 17:3
content: 3 People use crucibles and furnaces to test and refine silver and gold. Yahweh tests what people are thinking in a similar manner.

title: Proverbs 17:4
content: 4 People who act evilly listen carefully when people speak what is sinful; people who lie pay attention when people speak what destroys {others}.

title: Proverbs 17:5
content: 5 People who ridicule poor people despise Yahweh, who made them; Yahweh will certainly punish people who rejoice when other people experience disastrous things.

title: Proverbs 17:6
content: 6 Old people are proud of their grandchildren, and children are proud of their parents.

title: Proverbs 17:7
content: 7 It is not fitting for worthless people to speak eloquently. It is even less fitting for royal officials to speak falsely!

title: Proverbs 17:8
content: 8 People who pay bribes think that bribes are magical; {they think that} everything they do will be successful.

title: Proverbs 17:9
content: 9 People who want to love forgive people who wrong them, but people who repeatedly mention how someone wronged them cause friends to stop being friends.

title: Proverbs 17:10
content: 10 Rebuking causes understanding people to learn more than beating foolish people a hundred times {with a stick causes them to learn}.

title: Proverbs 17:11
content: 11 Evil people only want to rebel, so a merciless messenger will come and punish them.

title: Proverbs 17:12
content: 12 It would be better to meet a female bear that is furious because someone stole her cubs than to meet foolish people while they are acting foolishly!

title: Proverbs 17:13
content: 13 If people react to experiencing what is good by doing what is evil, then what is evil will continually affect their families.

title: Proverbs 17:14
content: 14 When people start arguing with each other, it is as difficult to stop as it is to stop water that is leaking out of something, so prevent yourself from arguing before you start to argue.

title: Proverbs 17:15
content: 15 There are people who acquit guilty people, and there are people who condemn innocent people; Yahweh detests both types of people.

title: Proverbs 17:16
content: 16 How useless it is for foolish people to try to pay money in order to become wise when they are unable to think!

title: Proverbs 17:17
content: 17 A friend loves {you} all the time, and relatives exist in order to help {other relatives} when disastrous things happen.

title: Proverbs 17:18
content: 18 People who do not think wisely agree to pay someone else’s loan and even guarantee to pay that loan in front of people whom they know.

title: Proverbs 17:19
content: 19 People who love to sin {also} love to cause people to argue; people who brag a lot cause others to destroy them.

title: Proverbs 17:20
content: 20 People who think deceitfully will never experience any good things, and bad things will happen to people who speak deceitfully.

title: Proverbs 17:21
content: 21 Foolish people grieve their parents. Indeed, worthless people will not cause their fathers to be joyful.

title: Proverbs 17:22
content: 22 People who feel happy will heal, but depressed people will be unhealthy.

title: Proverbs 17:23
content: 23 People secretly bribe wicked judges so that they judge unjustly.

title: Proverbs 17:24
content: 24 Understanding people concentrate on what is wise, but foolish people cannot concentrate on anything.

title: Proverbs 17:25
content: 25 Foolish children grieve their fathers and make their mothers miserable.

title: Proverbs 17:26
content: 26 Punishing innocent people is surely wrong, {and} beating royal officials is {also} wrong.

title: Proverbs 17:27
content: 27 People who refrain from speaking {unnecessarily} are knowledgeable, and people who remain calm are understanding people.

title: Proverbs 17:28
content: 28 People will think even foolish people are wise if those foolish people do not speak. Indeed, people who refrain from speaking are understanding people.

title: Proverbs 18:1
content: 1 People who avoid other people only care about doing what they want to do. They refuse to do anything that is wise.

title: Proverbs 18:2
content: 2 Foolish people hate {learning} what they should understand. Instead, they only like to tell others what they think.

title: Proverbs 18:3
content: 3 People treat wicked people contemptuously, and people scold people who act shamefully.

title: Proverbs 18:4
content: 4 What wise people say is as profound as a deep ocean. {Wise people are like} a fountain or brook that flows abundantly with what is wise.

title: Proverbs 18:5
content: 5 It is very evil {for judges} to favor guilty people in order to prevent judging innocent people justly.

title: Proverbs 18:6
content: 6 What foolish people say makes people argue, and it makes people want to beat them.

title: Proverbs 18:7
content: 7 What foolish people say will ruin them. Indeed, what they say will trouble them like a trap {troubles an animal}.

title: Proverbs 18:8
content: 8 People are eager to listen to what people who gossip say, and what they say deeply affects those who hear it.

title: Proverbs 18:9
content: 9 People who are lazy when they work are like people who destroy things.

title: Proverbs 18:10
content: 10 Yahweh is {like} a strong tower that righteous people run into and are safe.

title: Proverbs 18:11
content: 11 What rich people own keeps them safe like walls keep cities safe; they think what they own protects them as well as a high wall.

title: Proverbs 18:12
content: 12 If people think proudly, then something will destroy them; people must be humble before other people respect them.

title: Proverbs 18:13
content: 13 It is foolish and shameful for someone to reply to what a person has said before hearing it.

title: Proverbs 18:14
content: 14 How people feel can enable them to endure being sick. However, it is very difficult to make a depressed person feel better!

title: Proverbs 18:15
content: 15 Understanding people learn what they should know. Indeed, wise people try to learn what they should know.

title: Proverbs 18:16
content: 16 Giving something {to someone} can benefit the one who gives it; doing so can enable that person to meet important people.

title: Proverbs 18:17
content: 17 People who state their cases first seem to be right until people whom they know arrive and question them.

title: Proverbs 18:18
content: 18 Throwing lots {in order to decide something} can make people stop arguing, it can also decide who is right between powerful people.

title: Proverbs 18:19
content: 19 It is more difficult to reconcile with a relative {whom you have} offended than {to conquer} a fortified city; and when people argue, they avoid each other as if a castle’s strong gate were between them.

title: Proverbs 18:20
content: 20 What people say will satisfy them when they are hungry. Indeed, what people say will satisfy them.

title: Proverbs 18:21
content: 21 What people say can cause people to die or remain alive. And people who love to talk will experience the consequences {for what they say}.

title: Proverbs 18:22
content: 22 Men who marry get what is good and Yahweh approves of them.

title: Proverbs 18:23
content: 23 Poor people plead for others to be merciful {to them}, but rich people reply {to them} rudely.

title: Proverbs 18:24
content: 24 Having {unreliable} friends will destroy a person, but loving friends exist who are more loyal than brothers.

title: Proverbs 19:1
content: 1 It is better to be poor and behave honestly than to speak deceitfully and be foolish.

title: Proverbs 19:2
content: 2 Furthermore, it is very bad for people to not know {what they should know}; people sin who act hastily.

title: Proverbs 19:3
content: 3 People who act foolishly destroy themselves, yet they become furious with Yahweh {and blame him}.

title: Proverbs 19:4
content: 4 Wealthy people {easily} make many friends, but poor people lose {even} the friends they have.

title: Proverbs 19:5
