content: 5 Someone will surely punish lying witnesses. Indeed, someone will surely punish people who lie easily.

title: Proverbs 19:6
content: 6 A lot of people want royal officials to favor them, and {it seems like} everyone wants to be friends with generous people.

title: Proverbs 19:7
content: 7 All the relatives of poor people despise them, and even their friends avoid them! Although they call out {to them for help}, they do not {respond}.

title: Proverbs 19:8
content: 8 People who think wisely benefit themselves; people who remember what they should understand will surely succeed.

title: Proverbs 19:9
content: 9 Someone will surely punish lying witnesses. Indeed, people who lie easily will die.

title: Proverbs 19:10
content: 10 It is wrong for foolish people to live luxuriously, and it is even worse for slaves to reign over princes!

title: Proverbs 19:11
content: 11 Insightful people do not get angry quickly, and people show how honorable they are by forgiving {people who} sin {against them}.

title: Proverbs 19:12
content: 12 When kings are furious, they frighten people like the roaring of young lions {frightens people}, but when they approve of people, it is as refreshing as dew on plants.

title: Proverbs 19:13
content: 13 Foolish children destroy their fathers, and when wives argue {with their husbands}, it is {as annoying as} constantly dripping water.

title: Proverbs 19:14
content: 14 People inherit houses and riches from their fathers, but Yahweh {alone} gives {men} insightful wives.

title: Proverbs 19:15
content: 15 Lazy people sleep well, but {such} idle people are {always} hungry.

title: Proverbs 19:16
content: 16 People who obey what others command them enable themselves to stay alive, but people who do not care about what they do will die.

title: Proverbs 19:17
content: 17 Being kind to poor people is {like} loaning money to Yahweh; he will reward anyone who does so.

title: Proverbs 19:18
content: 18 Correct your children while you still can; and do not allow yourself to kill them.

title: Proverbs 19:19
content: 19 Very angry people will pay {for being angry}; if you rescue them {from what they must pay}, you will have to do so again and again.

title: Proverbs 19:20
content: 20 Pay attention to what people advise you {to do} and let people teach you in order to become wise when you are about to die.

title: Proverbs 19:21
content: 21 People plan to do many things, but {only} what Yahweh advises will succeed.

title: Proverbs 19:22
content: 22 People want others to be faithful, and poor people are better than people who lie.

title: Proverbs 19:23
content: 23 Reverently fearing Yahweh causes people to live for a long time; such people rest contently, nothing will harm them.

title: Proverbs 19:24
content: 24 Lazy people put their hands in a dish {of food}, {but are so lazy that} they will not lift the food to their mouths.

title: Proverbs 19:25
content: 25 {If you} punish people who ridicule {others}, {then} naive people {who see you do that} will become sensible. {If you} correct understanding people, {then} they will learn what they should know.

title: Proverbs 19:26
content: 26 Children who act violently toward their fathers and chase away their mothers are disgraceful and embarrassing.

title: Proverbs 19:27
content: 27 My child, if you stop listening to what people teach you, then you will reject what you {already} know that people told you.

title: Proverbs 19:28
content: 28 Worthless witnesses scorn what is just, and wicked people enjoy acting sinfully as if they were gulping down delicious food.

title: Proverbs 19:29
content: 29 Yahweh is ready to condemn people who ridicule {others}, and he is ready to beat fools on their backs.

title: Proverbs 20:1
content: 1 People who drink too much of what can intoxicate them ridicule and fight others; all people who cannot walk properly because they drank too much of what can intoxicate them are very foolish.

title: Proverbs 20:2
content: 2 When kings are terrifyingly angry, they frighten people like the roaring of young lions {frightens people}; people who make kings angry cause themselves to die.

title: Proverbs 20:3
content: 3 It is honorable to cease arguing with other people, but all foolish people are eager to argue with others.

title: Proverbs 20:4
content: 4 Lazy farmers do not plow {their fields} when they should, so when it is time to harvest {crops}, they look {for crops in their fields}, but there are none.

title: Proverbs 20:5
content: 5 Discerning what people are thinking about advising {others} is {as difficult as} drawing water out of a deep {well}, but understanding people are able to do so.

title: Proverbs 20:6
content: 6 Many people claim to be faithful, but very few people act faithfully!

title: Proverbs 20:7
content: 7 Righteous people behave honestly; God will bless their children.

title: Proverbs 20:8
content: 8 {Ideally,} kings who sit on their thrones in order to judge {people} discern anything that is evil and remove it {from their lands}.

title: Proverbs 20:9
content: 9 No one can truthfully say, “I do not think sinfully anymore; I do not sin anymore.”

title: Proverbs 20:10
content: 10 Yahweh detests {people dishonestly using} differing weights and measurements {to benefit themselves}.

title: Proverbs 20:11
content: 11 Even young people show people {who they are} by what they do; how they act shows whether they are innocent and right.

title: Proverbs 20:12
content: 12 Yahweh has made both ears with which to hear and eyes with which to see.

title: Proverbs 20:13
content: 13 If you sleep a lot, you will become poor; {but} if you stay awake {and work}, you will have plenty of food.

title: Proverbs 20:14
content: 14 Buyers claim that something is not good at all {when they are bargaining with you about its price}. But {after they buy it,} they go and boast {to their friends about the good price they bought it for}.

title: Proverbs 20:15
content: 15 Gold and precious jewels are plentiful, but the knowledgeable things that people say are extremely precious.

title: Proverbs 20:16
content: 16 Take the coats of people who promise to pay a loan for someone whom they do not know. Indeed, hold onto the coats of people who do so for a foreigner.

title: Proverbs 20:17
content: 17 Food people get by deceiving {others} may taste sweet {to them}, but what eventually happens to them will be as unpleasant as having a mouth full of stones.

title: Proverbs 20:18
content: 18 What people plan succeeds when others advise them, so let others advise you before you start fighting a war.

title: Proverbs 20:19
content: 19 People who walk around gossiping tell {others} what is secret, so avoid people who speak carelessly.

title: Proverbs 20:20
content: 20 People who curse their parents {will die like} an oil lamp that stops burning {oil} in a totally dark place.

title: Proverbs 20:21
content: 21 What people inherit hastily before the proper time will ultimately not result in {Yahweh} blessing {them}.

title: Proverbs 20:22
content: 22 Do not say that you will harm someone who has harmed you. Rather, wait for Yahweh {to resolve the matter}, so that he may vindicate you.

title: Proverbs 20:23
content: 23 Yahweh detests {people dishonestly using} differing weights {to benefit themselves}. Indeed, {using} weighing instruments in order to deceive {others} is very bad.

title: Proverbs 20:24
content: 24 Yahweh directs what happens to powerful people. So then, people surely cannot comprehend what will happen to them!

title: Proverbs 20:25
content: 25 It is dangerous for people to declare thoughtlessly that something is holy to Yahweh, and then think about what they have done after they have done so.

title: Proverbs 20:26
content: 26 Wise kings remove wicked people {from their lands}, and {they punish them like farmers} crush grain under a threshing wheel.

title: Proverbs 20:27
content: 27 People’s spirits are {like} lamps that Yahweh has given them; they help people discern everything that deeply affects them.

title: Proverbs 20:28
content: 28 Being faithful and trustworthy makes kings safe. Indeed, being faithful enables them to rule securely.

title: Proverbs 20:29
content: 29 People admire young men because they are strong, but people admire old men because they are wise.

title: Proverbs 20:30
content: 30 Severely beating people may stop them from acting evilly, and hitting people {may change} what deeply affects them.

title: Proverbs 21:1
content: 1 Yahweh directs what kings think like {a farmer directs} streams to bring water anywhere he wants {it to go}.

title: Proverbs 21:2
content: 2 People think that everything they do is right, but Yahweh {rightly} evaluates what they think.

title: Proverbs 21:3
content: 3 Acting righteously and justly is more important to Yahweh than sacrificing animals {to him}.

title: Proverbs 21:4
content: 4 Being proud and arrogant guide what wicked people do like a lamp {shows people where to go}; they are sinful.

title: Proverbs 21:5
content: 5 What diligent people plan will certainly profit them, but all those who act too hastily will certainly become poor.

title: Proverbs 21:6
content: 6 When people gain wealth by speaking falsely, that wealth quickly vanishes like mist {and what they do} will kill them.

title: Proverbs 21:7
content: 7 When wicked people act violently, they destroy themselves because they refuse to act justly.

title: Proverbs 21:8
content: 8 Guilty people act perversely, but innocent people act uprightly.

title: Proverbs 21:9
content: 9 It is better to live {alone} in a corner of a housetop than to live inside a house with a wife who always argues {with you}.

title: Proverbs 21:10
content: 10 Wicked people strongly desire to act evilly, they will not be merciful to the people they know.

title: Proverbs 21:11
content: 11 If you punish people who ridicule others, {then} naive people {who see you do that} will become wise, and if you teach wise people, they will become {even more} knowledgeable.

title: Proverbs 21:12
content: 12 {Yahweh,} the Righteous One, knows the families of wicked people; he destroys them.

title: Proverbs 21:13
content: 13 People who refuse to listen to poor people when they cry out {for help} will also cry out {for help themselves}, but no one will help them.

title: Proverbs 21:14
content: 14 Secretly giving something to an angry person will stop them from being angry. Indeed, secretly bribing a furious person will calm them down.

title: Proverbs 21:15
content: 15 Righteous people enjoy acting justly, but acting justly terrifies people who act sinfully.

title: Proverbs 21:16
content: 16 People who stop behaving insightfully will end up in the place where the spirits of dead people are together.

title: Proverbs 21:17
content: 17 People who love what is pleasurable will be poor. Indeed, people who love {luxuries like} wine and olive oil will never be rich.

title: Proverbs 21:18
content: 18 Wicked people will suffer instead of righteous people, and treacherous people {will suffer} in place of upright people.

title: Proverbs 21:19
content: 19 It is better to live {alone} in a deserted land than {to live} with an argumentative and vexing wife.

title: Proverbs 21:20
content: 20 Wise people have precious riches and olive oil, but foolish people waste everything that they have.

title: Proverbs 21:21
content: 21 People who diligently try to be righteous and faithful will live {for a long time}, will be righteous, and people will respect them.

title: Proverbs 21:22
content: 22 Wise people conquer cities that mighty warriors are defending; they pull down the walls that people {in those cities} believe will protect them.

title: Proverbs 21:23
content: 23 People who are careful about anything they say avoid becoming distressed.

title: Proverbs 21:24
content: 24 People who ridicule others act presumptuously and arrogantly; they behave furiously and presumptuously.

title: Proverbs 21:25
content: 25 Lazy people want what will kill them because they refuse to work.

title: Proverbs 21:26
content: 26 Lazy people always want more things for themselves, but righteous people generously give {what they have to others}.

title: Proverbs 21:27
content: 27 What wicked people offer {to Yahweh} is detestable; it is even more {detestable} when they are offering something {to Yahweh} while intending to act wickedly!

title: Proverbs 21:28
content: 28 Witnesses who lie will die, but when people who listen carefully speak, others will always remember {what they said}.

title: Proverbs 21:29
content: 29 Wicked people show how stubborn they are, but upright people think about what they do.

title: Proverbs 21:30
content: 30 There is absolutely nothing that is wise, understanding, and advisable, but is {also} the opposite of what Yahweh wants.

title: Proverbs 21:31
content: 31 Soldiers prepare to fight, but Yahweh determines who wins {that fight}.

title: Proverbs 22:1
content: 1 Being someone whom people respect is more important than being very wealthy. Indeed, being someone whom others approve of is better than having silver and gold.

title: Proverbs 22:2
content: 2 Rich people and poor people have {at least} one thing in common: Yahweh made both of them.

title: Proverbs 22:3
content: 3 Sensible people observe something dangerous happening and avoid it, but naive people {ignorantly} do not avoid it and suffer {for doing so}.

title: Proverbs 22:4
content: 4 People who are humble, who reverently fear Yahweh, will become rich. People will respect them, and they will live {for a long time}.

title: Proverbs 22:5
content: 5 Deceptive people live {dangerously,} as if they were walking down a road covered with thorns and traps, {but} people who want to stay alive avoid living that way.

title: Proverbs 22:6
content: 6 Teach children how to behave {properly}, so that when they become old, they will still continue to do so.

title: Proverbs 22:7
content: 7 Rich people reign over poor people, and people who borrow {money} from others are slaves to the people who loaned them {money}.

title: Proverbs 22:8
content: 8 People who act unjustly will suffer for doing so, and they will no longer be able to furiously oppress other people.

title: Proverbs 22:9
content: 9 Yahweh will bless generous people because they give their own food to poor people.

title: Proverbs 22:10
content: 10 If you banish people who ridicule others, then people will stop arguing {with each other}, quarreling {with each other}, and shaming {each other}.

title: Proverbs 22:11
content: 11 People who love thinking purely speak graciously and are companions of kings.

title: Proverbs 22:12
content: 12 Yahweh preserves what people should know, but he makes what treacherous people say fail.

title: Proverbs 22:13
content: 13 Lazy people {do nothing because they} claim that there is a lion outside that will kill them in the street {if they go outside}.

title: Proverbs 22:14
content: 14 What adulterous women say is {as dangerous as} a deep hole; those whom Yahweh is angry with will fall into it.

title: Proverbs 22:15
content: 15 Children inherently think foolishly, but physically disciplining them will teach them to stop being foolish.

title: Proverbs 22:16
content: 16 People who oppress poor people in order to make more money for themselves or who give things to rich people {in order to become rich} will only become poor.

title: Proverbs 22:17
content: 17 Listen carefully to what wise people have said; consider carefully what I am teaching you!

title: Proverbs 22:18
content: 18 {Do this} because if you remember these sayings and are always ready to repeat them {to others}, then you will be glad.

title: Proverbs 22:19
content: 19 I am teaching these sayings to you—yes, you—right now so that you will trust Yahweh.

title: Proverbs 22:20
content: 20 I am indeed writing these 30 sayings to advise and teach you.

title: Proverbs 22:21
content: 21 {I am writing them} in order to teach you what is true in trustworthy sayings, and in order to answer those who sent you with trustworthy sayings.

title: Proverbs 22:22
content: 22 Do not steal from poor people just because they are poor; and do not oppress suffering people in court.

title: Proverbs 22:23
content: 23 {Do not do these things} because Yahweh will defend those poor people when you dispute with them, and he will kill the people who stole from them.

title: Proverbs 22:24
content: 24 Do not become friends with angry people. Indeed, do not associate with people who easily become angry.

title: Proverbs 22:25
content: 25 {If you do so,} then you will act like them, and you will endanger yourself like an animal caught in a trap.

title: Proverbs 22:26
content: 26 Stay away from those people who agree to pay loans for others. {Indeed, stay away from those people} who guarantee to pay the loans of others.

title: Proverbs 22:27
content: 27 {For} if you cannot pay back {the loan}, {then} the person to whom you owe money will surely take away even your own bed {in order to pay back the loan}.

title: Proverbs 22:28
content: 28 Do not cheat people by moving the stones that their ancestors placed long ago to mark the boundaries of their land.

title: Proverbs 22:29
content: 29 Consider this: People who work skillfully will serve kings rather than serving unknown people.

title: Proverbs 23:1
content: 1 When you sit down to eat {a meal} with someone who rules over others, pay attention to the food that is in front of you.

title: Proverbs 23:2
content: 2 Restrain yourself {from eating too much} if you like eating a lot of food.

title: Proverbs 23:3
content: 3 Do not crave the {expensive} food that the ruler has because that ruler is using that food to deceive you.

title: Proverbs 23:4
content: 4 Do not work so much that you exhaust yourself in order to become rich. Be understanding enough to stop doing so.

title: Proverbs 23:5
content: 5 As soon as you look at that wealth, it will surely be gone! {This is} because wealth certainly disappears quickly as if it had wings and flew off into the sky like a fast bird.

title: Proverbs 23:6
content: 6 Do not eat food that stingy people {give you}. Do not crave the expensive food that they have,

title: Proverbs 23:7
content: 7 because stingy people are always thinking about how much the food costs them. They will tell you to eat and drink, but they do not mean what they say.

title: Proverbs 23:8
content: 8 {When you realize this,} you will want to vomit what little food you ate. You will have wasted the kind things you said {to them}.

title: Proverbs 23:9
content: 9 Do not directly address foolish people because they will only despise the insightful things that you say.

title: Proverbs 23:10
content: 10 Do not cheat people by moving the old stones that mark the boundaries of their land. Do not claim the land that belongs to {defenseless} orphans,

title: Proverbs 23:11
content: 11 because {Yahweh is} the one who redeems them (and he} is powerful. He is the one who will defend them when they dispute with you.

title: Proverbs 23:12
content: 12 Consider carefully {what people say} when they correct you. Indeed, listen carefully to what people teach you.

title: Proverbs 23:13
content: 13 Do not refuse to discipline your children. If you physically punish them, they will not die.

title: Proverbs 23:14
content: 14 Physically punish your children, so that you may prevent them from dying.

title: Proverbs 23:15
content: 15 My child, if you are wise, then surely I myself will be very happy,

title: Proverbs 23:16
content: 16 and I will sincerely rejoice when you say what is right.

title: Proverbs 23:17
content: 17 Do not envy sinful people; instead always reverently fear Yahweh.

title: Proverbs 23:18
content: 18 {If you do so, then} you will surely have a {good} future, and what you hope will happen will indeed occur!

title: Proverbs 23:19
content: 19 My child, listen {to me} so that you can become wise. Make yourself think about behaving rightly.

title: Proverbs 23:20
content: 20 Stay away from drunkards and gluttons,

title: Proverbs 23:21
content: 21 because drunkards and gluttons will become poor. They sleep so much that they will only have rags to wear.

title: Proverbs 23:22
content: 22 Pay attention to your father, who enabled you to exist, and do not scorn your mother when she becomes old.

title: Proverbs 23:23
content: 23 Learn what is true and remember it. Learn what is wise and instructive and what you should understand.

title: Proverbs 23:24
content: 24 Fathers of righteous people are very joyful. Indeed, those who father wise people are happy because of them.

title: Proverbs 23:25
content: 25 So do what will make your parents happy! Do what will make your mother joyful!

title: Proverbs 23:26
content: 26 My son, pay close attention to me! Carefully observe what I do!

title: Proverbs 23:27
content: 27 {Do this} because prostitutes are as dangerous as a deep hole. Indeed, adulterous women are as dangerous as a well you cannot escape from.

title: Proverbs 23:28
content: 28 These very women certainly wait {for men to seduce} like robbers {wait for people to rob}. They cause many men to become unfaithful.

title: Proverbs 23:29
content: 29 These are the kind of people who are woeful, sorrowful, and quarrelsome, who lament, get hurt for no reason, and have red eyes:

title: Proverbs 23:30
content: 30 those people who drink too much wine and are always looking around for wine {to drink} that someone has prepared.

title: Proverbs 23:31
content: 31 Do not {even} look with pleasure at wine, even though it is beautifully red, glistens in the cup, and goes down your throat smoothly.

title: Proverbs 23:32
content: 32 Afterward the wine {only} harms you as if a poisonous snake had bitten you.

title: Proverbs 23:33
content: 33 {When you are drunk,} you will hallucinate, and you will speak perversely.

title: Proverbs 23:34
content: 34 You will feel {dizzy} as if you were trying to sleep on a ship that the sea was tossing back and forth. Indeed, you will feel as if you were trying to sleep while swaying at the top of a ship’s sails.

title: Proverbs 23:35
content: 35 {You will say,} “People hit me, but it did not hurt. People beat me, but I did not feel it. I wish I could be sober so that I could find even more wine {to drink} again!”

title: Proverbs 24:1
content: 1 Do not envy evil people; do not want to associate with them,

title: Proverbs 24:2
content: 2 because they plan to act violently, and they talk about troubling people.

title: Proverbs 24:3
content: 3 People build houses by acting wisely, they make houses stable by acting understandably.

title: Proverbs 24:4
content: 4 By acting knowledgeably, people fill the rooms {of those houses} with all kinds of valuable and delightful riches.

title: Proverbs 24:5
content: 5 Wise people are strong, and knowledgeable people make themselves more powerful,

title: Proverbs 24:6
content: 6 because letting people advise you will make you fight your war successfully, and letting many people counsel you will rescue you {from losing the war}.

title: Proverbs 24:7
content: 7 Foolish people cannot understand what is wise; they have nothing to say in court.

title: Proverbs 24:8
content: 8 {Some} people are always planning to act evilly; other people refer to them as schemers.

title: Proverbs 24:9
content: 9 Foolish plans are sinful, and people detest people who ridicule others.

title: Proverbs 24:10
content: 10 If you fail during distressful times, then you are weak.

title: Proverbs 24:11
content: 11 Save people whom others are {unjustly} leading away to kill; prevent them from staggering to {the place where} people will {unjustly} slaughter them!

title: Proverbs 24:12
content: 12 If you {falsely} claim that you did not know that those people were dying unjustly, then think about this: Yahweh discerns what people think and surely understands! He keeps you alive and surely knows! He will surely make people receive what they deserve for what they have done!

title: Proverbs 24:13
content: 13 My child, eat honey because it tastes good, and honey dripping from the comb tastes sweet.

title: Proverbs 24:14
content: 14 Be aware that what is wise is like honey for you. If you become wise, then you will have a {good} future, and what you hope will happen will indeed occur!

title: Proverbs 24:15
content: 15 Do not be like wicked people and hide in wait in order to attack the places where righteous people dwell. Do not devastate the places where righteous people rest!

title: Proverbs 24:16
content: 16 {Do not do so} because righteous people can recover many times when disastrous things happen to them, but disastrous things will destroy wicked people.

title: Proverbs 24:17
content: 17 Do not be happy when something disastrous happens to your adversaries. Indeed, do not rejoice when that happens!

title: Proverbs 24:18
content: 18 If you do, then Yahweh will notice and disapprove, so that he stops being angry with your enemies.

title: Proverbs 24:19
content: 19 Do not worry about people who do what is evil. Do not be jealous of wicked people.

title: Proverbs 24:20
content: 20 {Do not do so} because evil people will not have {good} futures, {but} wicked people {will merely die} like an oil lamp that stops burning {oil}.

title: Proverbs 24:21
content: 21 My child, reverently fear Yahweh and kings. Avoid people who rebel {against either Yahweh or the king},

title: Proverbs 24:22
content: 22 because disastrous things will happen quickly to those people, and no one knows how terribly both Yahweh and kings can destroy {others}!

title: Proverbs 24:23
content: 23 Here are more things that wise people have said: It is very evil to favor someone when you judge.

title: Proverbs 24:24
content: 24 Many people will curse and people groups will hate anyone who declares that any guilty person is innocent.

title: Proverbs 24:25
content: 25 However, people who condemn {guilty people} will prosper, and Yahweh will bless them well.

title: Proverbs 24:26
content: 26 People who answer honestly show that they are true friends.

title: Proverbs 24:27
content: 27 Do the work you must do outside and prepare your fields before you build your house.

title: Proverbs 24:28
content: 28 Do not testify against someone you know if you do not have a good reason {to do so}. Do not speak deceitfully!

title: Proverbs 24:29
content: 29 Do not say, “I will do to him that same {bad} thing he did to me; I will pay him back for what he did to me!”

title: Proverbs 24:30
content: 30 I walked by the land of a lazy person and past the vineyard of someone who does not think wisely.

title: Proverbs 24:31
content: 31 And I saw that thistles and weeds were everywhere in that field and vineyard. Even the stone wall surrounding them had fallen down.

title: Proverbs 24:32
content: 32 When I saw {that}, I considered carefully {what I was seeing}. When I observed {that}, I learned {this}:

title: Proverbs 24:33
content: 33 {You say to yourself,} “Let me sleep just a little more! Let me lay my hands {across my chest} in order to rest comfortably for a little while longer!”

title: Proverbs 24:34
content: 34 {Being so lazy} will result in you suddenly becoming poor and needy as if a thief has attacked you.

title: Proverbs 25:1
content: 1 Here are more wise sayings said by Solomon that the scribes who served Hezekiah, the king of Judah, copied {from a scroll that Solomon had written}:

title: Proverbs 25:2
content: 2 God shows how glorious he is when he makes something difficult for people to understand. But kings show how glorious they are when they explain something {that is difficult for people to understand}.

title: Proverbs 25:3
content: 3 As people cannot fully understand how high the sky is or how deep the earth is, so they cannot fully understand what kings think.

title: Proverbs 25:4
content: 4 People who make things from metal must remove scum from silver before they can make {that silver into} something.

title: Proverbs 25:5
content: 5 {In the same way,} people must remove wicked advisers from the presence of kings before acting righteously causes kings to rule securely.

title: Proverbs 25:6
content: 6 Do not promote yourself in front of kings, and do not pretend to be great.

title: Proverbs 25:7
content: 7 {Do not do so} because it is better if someone invites you to come closer {to a king}, than for someone to embarrass you in front of a royal official whom you have seen {by telling you to move away from a king}.

title: Proverbs 25:8
content: 8 Do not plead your case too quickly against someone you know. If you do, then you will not know what to do when that person {wins the case and} embarrasses you!

title: Proverbs 25:9
content: 9 If you do indeed plead your case against someone you know, then do not tell {others} what is secret about that person.

title: Proverbs 25:10
content: 10 If do you, then people may hear you and disgrace you, and people will continue to speak badly about you.

title: Proverbs 25:11
content: 11 What someone says aptly is {as delightful as} golden apples that someone has set in silver.

title: Proverbs 25:12
content: 12 When someone wisely rebukes someone who is willing to listen, it is {as valuable as} a gold ring or jewelry made from the best gold.

title: Proverbs 25:13
content: 13 Reliable messengers are as refreshing to those who sent them as cold snow at the time when people harvest crops; they refresh the people whom they serve.

title: Proverbs 25:14
content: 14 People who brag about giving something that they never gave are as disappointing as clouds and wind that do not bring rain.

title: Proverbs 25:15
content: 15 People can persuade leaders by acting patiently, and by speaking gently people can convince those who oppose them {to agree with them}.

title: Proverbs 25:16
content: 16 If you discover some wild honey, do not eat too much of it. If you do, then you will become sick and vomit.

title: Proverbs 25:17
content: 17 {In the same way,} do not visit too often the houses of people you know. If you do, then they may become weary of you or {even} hate you.

title: Proverbs 25:18
content: 18 People who lie when they testify against people they know are {deadly, like} a club, sword, or piercing arrow.

title: Proverbs 25:19
content: 19 Trusting treacherous people during distressful times is {as useless as having} a rotten tooth or a crippled foot.

title: Proverbs 25:20
content: 20 Singing to someone who is sad is {as unhelpful as} taking a coat off of someone in cold weather or pouring vinegar on soda.

title: Proverbs 25:21
content: 21 Feed your enemies if they are hungry; give them something to drink if they are thirsty.

title: Proverbs 25:22
content: 22 {Do so} because by doing so you {will shame them, as if you} are pouring burning coals on top of them, and Yahweh will reward you {for doing so}.

title: Proverbs 25:23
content: 23 When wind blows from the north, rain will fall. In the same way, when people tell the secrets of others, people get angry.

title: Proverbs 25:24
content: 24 It is better to live {alone} in a corner of a housetop than to live inside a house with a wife who always argues {with you}.

title: Proverbs 25:25
content: 25 When people hear something good from a faraway place, it is as {refreshing as drinking} cold water when you are thirsty.

title: Proverbs 25:26
content: 26 When righteous people yield to wicked people, it is {as bad as} a spring that people have made murky by walking in it or {as bad as} a polluted fountain.

title: Proverbs 25:27
content: 27 {As} it is very bad to eat too much honey; so it is dishonorable to try to make people honor you.

title: Proverbs 25:28
content: 28 People who cannot control themselves are {as defenseless as} a city that an army has broken into and knocked down its walls.

title: Proverbs 26:1
content: 1 Honoring foolish people is just as inappropriate as snow {falling} in {hot} summer and rain {falling} during the time to harvest crops.

title: Proverbs 26:2
content: 2 When someone curses innocent people, it is like birds that fly around and do not land {on those innocent people}.

title: Proverbs 26:3
content: 3 As people must whip horses and bridle donkeys {in order to guide them}, so people must physically punish foolish people {in order to guide them}.

title: Proverbs 26:4
content: 4 {Sometimes,} do not reply to foolish people according to their foolish way of thinking. If you do, then you also will be foolish.

title: Proverbs 26:5
content: 5 {Sometimes,} reply to foolish people according to their foolish way of thinking. If you do not, then they may think that they are wise.

title: Proverbs 26:6
content: 6 People who send foolish people to tell {someone else} something on their behalf {harm themselves like} someone who cuts off his own feet or drinks what is harmful.

title: Proverbs 26:7
content: 7 {As} the legs of people who cannot walk are useless, so are the sayings that foolish people say.

title: Proverbs 26:8
content: 8 Honoring foolish people is just {as useless} as a harmless weapon.

title: Proverbs 26:9
content: 9 {As} a thistle that pierces the hand of a drunk person {hurts that person}, so are the sayings that foolish people say.

title: Proverbs 26:10
content: 10 People who employ foolish people or random strangers are {as dangerous} as someone who injures all the people {near him} by shooting arrows {at them}.

title: Proverbs 26:11
content: 11 Foolish people who do the same foolish thing over and over again are like dogs that eat what they have vomited up.

title: Proverbs 26:12
content: 12 Consider this: Foolish people are more likely to improve themselves than people who {wrongly} think they are wise.

title: Proverbs 26:13
content: 13 Lazy people {do nothing because they} claim that there is a lion in the path or in the midst of the streets.

title: Proverbs 26:14
content: 14 As doors swing on their hinges {and do not go anywhere}, so lazy people turn back and forth in their beds.

title: Proverbs 26:15
content: 15 Lazy people put their hands in a dish {of food}, {but} they are so lazy that they will not lift the food to their mouths.

title: Proverbs 26:16
content: 16 Lazy people {wrongly} think that they are wiser than many people who answer discreetly.

title: Proverbs 26:17
content: 17 People who make themselves angry because of something not concerning them that other people are arguing about are {as foolish as} people who cause dogs to bite them by pulling their ears when they walk by.

title: Proverbs 26:18
content: 18 (18-19) People who trick people they know and say that they were just joking are {as dangerous} as a crazy person who {uses a bow to} shoot flaming darks or deadly arrows {at people}.

title: Proverbs 26:20
content: 20 Fires stop burning when they have nothing {to burn}. In the same way, people stop arguing when no one is gossiping.

title: Proverbs 26:21
content: 21 {As} charcoal keeps coals burning and wood keeps fires burning, so people who always argue keep other people arguing.

title: Proverbs 26:22
content: 22 People are eager to listen to what people who gossip say, and what they say deeply affects those who hear it.

title: Proverbs 26:23
content: 23 What people fervently say while thinking evilly is {as deceptive as} a cheap pot that someone has covered with a pretty coating.

title: Proverbs 26:24
content: 24 People who hate you will use what they say to hide what they feel, but they are {really} thinking about how to betray you.

title: Proverbs 26:25
content: 25 Do not believe those people when they speak kindly to you, because they are thinking many detestable things.

title: Proverbs 26:26
content: 26 Although those people prevent others from knowing that they hate you by deceiving them, everyone will realize how wicked they are.

title: Proverbs 26:27
content: 27 People who dig pits to trap others will fall into those pits instead; and people who try to crush others with stones will become crushed by those stones instead.

title: Proverbs 26:28
content: 28 Liars hate the people whom they hurt, and flatterers cause disastrous things to happen.

title: Proverbs 27:1
content: 1 Do not brag about what {you think} will happen tomorrow, because you do not know what will happen then.

title: Proverbs 27:2
content: 2 Do not praise yourself; let someone else praise you. Indeed, let someone who does not know you praise you, not yourself.

title: Proverbs 27:3
content: 3 Stones and sand are heavy, but how provocative fools are is like something that is heavier than both of them.

title: Proverbs 27:4
content: 4 Angry people are cruel and furious people are destructive, but no one can resist jealous people!

title: Proverbs 27:5
content: 5 It is better to correct people openly, than to love them without them knowing that you do.

title: Proverbs 27:6
content: 6 Friends will be faithful to you by criticizing you {when necessary}, but enemies will deceive you by acting affectionately toward you.

title: Proverbs 27:7
content: 7 When people who have full stomachs see {on the ground} honey dripping from the comb, they step on it {because they are not hungry}. but even bitter things taste sweet to hungry people {because they are so hungry}.

title: Proverbs 27:8
content: 8 People who stray from their homes are like birds that stray from their nests.

title: Proverbs 27:9
content: 9 Just as fragrant oil and perfume make people feel happy, so when your friends advise you sincerely, they show how kind they are.

title: Proverbs 27:10
content: 10 Do not abandon your friends or your father’s friends. Do not go to the houses of your relatives when something disastrous happens to you. {Rather,} it is better to go to a neighbor than to relatives who live far away.

title: Proverbs 27:11
content: 11 My child, act wisely and make me happy, so that I will be able to reply to anyone who argues against me.

title: Proverbs 27:12
content: 12 Sensible people observe something dangerous happening and avoid it, but naive people {ignorantly} do not avoid it and suffer {for doing so}.

title: Proverbs 27:13
content: 13 Take the coats of people who promise to pay a loan for someone whom they do not know. Indeed, hold onto the coats of people who do so for a foreigner.

title: Proverbs 27:14
content: 14 People will think that someone they know is cursing them if that person speaks loudly to bless them early in the morning.

title: Proverbs 27:15
content: 15 A wife who always argues {with you} is as {annoying as} constantly dripping water on a rainy day.

title: Proverbs 27:16
content: 16 It is as difficult to stop her {from arguing} as stopping the wind, or catching oil in one hand.

title: Proverbs 27:17
content: 17 Just as iron can sharpen an iron {blade}, so too people can help people they know improve how they think.

title: Proverbs 27:18
content: 18 Just as people who take care of fruit trees will eat the fruit from those trees {as a result}, so too will masters honor their servants who guard them.

title: Proverbs 27:19
content: 19 When people look in water, the water reflects their faces. In the same way, what people think reveals what kinds of people they are.

title: Proverbs 27:20
content: 20 Just as the place where dead people go never becomes full; so people never stop wanting {something}.

title: Proverbs 27:21
content: 21 People use crucibles and furnaces to test and refine silver and gold. In the same way, people test what kind of person someone is by saying good things about that person.

title: Proverbs 27:22
content: 22 If you were to crush a fool the way you would crush grain {into powder}, you would still not be able to stop that person from acting foolishly.

title: Proverbs 27:23
content: 23 Be fully aware of how your sheep are doing. Indeed, consider carefully how your animals fare.

title: Proverbs 27:24
content: 24 {Do so} because riches will not last forever. Even a king’s family will not rule forever!

title: Proverbs 27:25
content: 25 Harvest the grass and then you will see new grass. Collect {and store} the plants that grow on the hillside.

title: Proverbs 27:26
content: 26 {If you do these things, then} you will have lambs with wool that you can clothe yourself with. You will also have male goats that you can sell for enough money to buy a field.

title: Proverbs 27:27
content: 27 You will even have female goats that produce enough milk for yourself, your family, and your servant girls to drink.

title: Proverbs 28:1
content: 1 Wicked people run away even though no one is chasing them, but righteous people are as brave as lions.

title: Proverbs 28:2
content: 2 When the people in a country sin, they have many leaders; but when they have a truly knowledgeable ruler, they will last.

title: Proverbs 28:3
content: 3 Poor people who oppress other poor people are {as destructive as} rain that destroys all the crops, so that there is nothing to eat.

title: Proverbs 28:4
content: 4 People who reject {Yahweh’s} laws say good things about wicked people; but people who obey those laws oppose such wicked people.

title: Proverbs 28:5
content: 5 Evil people cannot comprehend what is just, but people who desire to please Yahweh comprehend everything about it.

title: Proverbs 28:6
content: 6 It is better to be poor and act honestly than to act dishonestly and be rich.

title: Proverbs 28:7
content: 7 People who obey {Yahweh’s} laws are discerning children, but people who befriend gluttons disgrace their fathers.

title: Proverbs 28:8
content: 8 People who become wealthy by charging an unreasonably large amount of interest {from those to whom they loan money} {unknowingly} collect that wealth to give it to people who are kind to poor people.

title: Proverbs 28:9
content: 9 Yahweh detests what people pray if those people refuse to even listen to his laws.

title: Proverbs 28:10
content: 10 People who guide upright people to act evilly will destroy themselves by what they do, but people whom Yahweh does not blame {for acting wickedly} will receive what is good.

title: Proverbs 28:11
content: 11 Rich people may {wrongly} think that they are wise, but discerning poor people will prove that those people are not {wise}.

title: Proverbs 28:12
content: 12 People celebrate when righteous people become powerful, but people hide when wicked people become powerful.

title: Proverbs 28:13
content: 13 People who {try to} hide the sinful things that they do will never be successful, but Yahweh will be merciful to people who confess the sinful things that they have done and stop doing them.

title: Proverbs 28:14
content: 14 People who always reverently fear Yahweh are happy, but bad things happen to stubborn people.

title: Proverbs 28:15
content: 15 Wicked people who rule over poor people are {as dangerous as} a roaring lion or attacking bear.

title: Proverbs 28:16
content: 16 Leaders who are not understanding severely oppress {other people}, {but} people who despise gaining wealth unjustly will live for a long time.

title: Proverbs 28:17
content: 17 People who murder others will keep running away {from those who would punish them} until they die. Do not help them!

title: Proverbs 28:18
content: 18 Yahweh will rescue people whom he does not blame for how they act, but people who act dishonestly will suddenly ruin themselves.

title: Proverbs 28:19
content: 19 People who work hard will have enough food {to eat}, but people who waste time doing worthless things will only be poor.

title: Proverbs 28:20
content: 20 Yahweh abundantly blesses faithful people, but he will certainly punish people who are eager to be wealthy.

title: Proverbs 28:21
content: 21 Although it is very evil to favor someone, some people will sin {by doing so} to get as little as a scrap of food.

title: Proverbs 28:22
content: 22 Although people who are eager to become rich are stingy, they do not realize that they will become poor.

title: Proverbs 28:23
content: 23 People approve of someone who corrects them after that person does so more than {they might approve of} someone who speaks flatteringly {to them}.

title: Proverbs 28:24
content: 24 People who rob their parents and say that doing so is not wrong are as bad as murderers.

title: Proverbs 28:25
content: 25 Greedy people cause people to argue with each other, but Yahweh will prosper people who trust him.

title: Proverbs 28:26
content: 26 People who trust themselves are foolish, but people who act wisely are the ones who will escape {what is dangerous}.

title: Proverbs 28:27
content: 27 People who give poor people {what they need} will have all that they need, but Yahweh abundantly curses people who ignore poor people.

title: Proverbs 28:28
content: 28 People hide when wicked people become powerful, but when those wicked people die, there will be more and more righteous people.

title: Proverbs 29:1
content: 1 Some people become stubborn when other people correct them, someone will destroy them instantly and they will not be able to recover.

title: Proverbs 29:2
content: 2 People are joyful when righteous people become numerous, but people are miserable when wicked people rule {over them}.

title: Proverbs 29:3
content: 3 People who cherish what is wise make their fathers happy, but people who have sex with prostitutes waste all their money.

title: Proverbs 29:4
content: 4 Kings make the people in their land succeed by acting justly, but leaders who take money dishonestly ruin the people in their land.

title: Proverbs 29:5
content: 5 People who flatter people they know {are deceptive}, {they are like} people who try to trap others.

title: Proverbs 29:6
content: 6 Evil people endanger themselves by acting sinfully, but righteous people sing joyfully and are happy.

title: Proverbs 29:7
content: 7 Righteous people care about the rights of poor people, but wicked people do not care about them at all.

title: Proverbs 29:8
content: 8 People who mock others agitate people living in a city, but wise people stop others from being angry.

title: Proverbs 29:9
content: 9 If wise people sue foolish people, the foolish people will rage and sneer and not resolve anything.

title: Proverbs 29:10
content: 10 Murderers despise people whom Yahweh does not blame {for acting wickedly}, but upright people try to protect those people.

title: Proverbs 29:11
content: 11 Foolish people uncontrollably express everything that they feel, but wise people control how they express what they feel.

title: Proverbs 29:12
content: 12 Leaders who believe the false things that people tell them have only wicked servants.

title: Proverbs 29:13
content: 13 Poor people and the people who oppress {them} have {at least} one thing in common: Yahweh is the one who caused them to live.

title: Proverbs 29:14
content: 14 Kings who judge poor people according to what is true will always rule securely.

title: Proverbs 29:15
content: 15 If parents punish and correct their children, doing so can make those children wise; but if parents let their children do whatever they want to do, then their children will disgrace them.

title: Proverbs 29:16
content: 16 People sin more when wicked people become numerous, but righteous people will witness Yahweh destroy those wicked people.

title: Proverbs 29:17
content: 17 Discipline your children, so that they will make you feel peaceful and will delight you.

title: Proverbs 29:18
content: 18 When Yahweh does not reveal anything {to his prophets}, then people do not control themselves, but people who obey {Yahweh’s} laws are happy.

title: Proverbs 29:19
content: 19 You cannot correct servants by {only} speaking to them because they will not respond to you, even if they understand {what you say}.

title: Proverbs 29:20
content: 20 Consider this: Foolish people are more likely to improve themselves than people who speak thoughtlessly.

title: Proverbs 29:21
content: 21 If you give your servants everything they want when they are young, then they will eventually be arrogant.

title: Proverbs 29:22
content: 22 People who easily become angry cause people to argue. Indeed, angry people cause people to sin.

title: Proverbs 29:23
content: 23 People will humiliate proud people for being proud, but people will honor humble people.

title: Proverbs 29:24
content: 24 People who help thieves only hurt themselves. They hear that Yahweh will curse them {for not speaking what is true}, but they do not say anything.

title: Proverbs 29:25
content: 25 Being anxious is {as dangerous as} a trap, but people who trust Yahweh will be safe.

title: Proverbs 29:26
content: 26 Many people want leaders to help them, but Yahweh is the only one who does what is just for them.

title: Proverbs 29:27
content: 27 Righteous people detest unjust people, but wicked people detest people who act uprightly.

title: Proverbs 30:1
content: 1 {These are} the sayings of Agur son of Jakeh, which Yahweh told him to say; {these are what} Agur declared to Ithiel, even to Ithiel and Ucal:

title: Proverbs 30:2
content: 2 I am certainly less intelligent than other people. Indeed, I do not understand as much as everyone else understands!

title: Proverbs 30:3
content: 3 I have never learned about what is wise, nor do I know about {Yahweh,} the Holy One.

title: Proverbs 30:4
content: 4 Surely nobody has ever gone to heaven and returned to earth! Surely nobody has ever controlled the wind! Surely nobody has ever gathered the water for rain in the clouds! Surely nobody has ever formed the boundaries of the earth! {If such a person exists, then} what is his name? And what is the name of his son? Surely you do not know {about such a person}!

title: Proverbs 30:5
content: 5 Everything that God says is true; he is {like} a shield that protects people who trust him to protect them.

title: Proverbs 30:6
content: 6 Never claim that God has said something other than what he has {actually} said. If you do that, then he will correct you and he will prove that you lied {about what he said}.

title: Proverbs 30:7
content: 7 I ask Yahweh for two things, and ask that he give them to me before I die:

title: Proverbs 30:8
content: 8 {I ask that he} prevent me from being dishonest or speaking what is not true. {I also ask that he} not let me become too poor or too rich, {but} just provide the proper amount of food for me.

title: Proverbs 30:9
content: 9 If I become too rich, then I may reject Yahweh and claim that I do not know him. Or if I become too poor, then I may rob {other people}, so that I dishonor my God.

title: Proverbs 30:10
content: 10 Never say bad things about servants to the people whom they serve. If you do, then they will curse you, and people will hold you responsible {for what you said}.

title: Proverbs 30:11
content: 11 Some people frequently curse their parents.

title: Proverbs 30:12
content: 12 Some people think they are sinless, but they are {actually guilty like} people who have not cleaned off their filth.

title: Proverbs 30:13
content: 13 Some people are extremely arrogant!

title: Proverbs 30:14
content: 14 Some people {harshly oppress poor people as if they} were animals who remove poor people from the world by eating them up with very sharp teeth.

title: Proverbs 30:15
content: 15 {Greedy people are like} animals that suck blood and have two daughters. {The names of both of them are} Give Me Some! There are three, no, four things that always want more:

title: Proverbs 30:16
content: 16 the place where dead people are, childless women, soil that never receives enough water, and fire, which always needs something to burn.

title: Proverbs 30:17
content: 17 People who ridicule their fathers, and refuse to obey their mothers {will die and} wild birds will pluck out their eyes, and young scavenging birds will eat them.

title: Proverbs 30:18
content: 18 There are three, no, four things that are too amazing for me to comprehend:

title: Proverbs 30:19
content: 19 how birds fly in the air, how snakes slither over rocks, how ships sail in the middle of the ocean, and how young men act {lovingly} with young women.

title: Proverbs 30:20
content: 20 Acting adulterously is {as easy} for adulterous women as eating, wiping their mouths, and claiming that they have not sinned at all.

title: Proverbs 30:21
content: 21 There are three, no, four things that {the people in} the world cannot tolerate:

title: Proverbs 30:22
content: 22 when slaves become rulers, when worthless people have plenty of food to eat,

title: Proverbs 30:23
content: 23 when women whom people hate marry someone, and when servant girls replace the wives of their masters.

title: Proverbs 30:24
content: 24 There are four creatures in the world that are small but extremely wise:

title: Proverbs 30:25
content: 25 Although ants are weak insects, during the right time they store their food {to eat during the winter}.

title: Proverbs 30:26
content: 26 Although hyraxes are weak animals, they make their homes {among the rocks} on cliffs.

title: Proverbs 30:27
content: 27 Although locusts do not have a king, they move in orderly groups like soldiers in an army.

title: Proverbs 30:28
content: 28 Although lizards are small enough to hold in your hands, you can find them inside kings’ palaces.

title: Proverbs 30:29
content: 29 There are three, no, four things that look very impressive when they walk:

title: Proverbs 30:30
content: 30 lions, which are the most powerful animals and never flee from anything,

title: Proverbs 30:31
content: 31 strutting male birds, male goats, and kings whom people are afraid to rebel against.

title: Proverbs 30:32
content: 32 If you have acted foolishly by bragging about yourself, or if you were plotting {to do what is evil}, then stop doing so immediately!

title: Proverbs 30:33
content: 33 {Stop doing so} because {doing so will cause bad things to happen to you,} just as churning milking turns it into butter, squeezing a nose will make it bleed, and making people angry causes them to fight.

title: Proverbs 31:1
content: 1 {These are} the sayings of King Lemuel; Yahweh had spoken these sayings that his mother had taught him:

title: Proverbs 31:2
content: 2 My son, whom I gave birth to and whom I vowed {to dedicate to Yahweh}, listen to me!

title: Proverbs 31:3
content: 3 Do not exhaust yourself by having sex with women; they can destroy kings.

title: Proverbs 31:4
content: 4 Lemuel, kings should certainly not drink wine, and rulers should not want to drink what can intoxicate {them}.”

title: Proverbs 31:5
content: 5 If they do so, then they might forget the laws {that they have made} and prevent all suffering people from getting what they legally deserve.

title: Proverbs 31:6
content: 6 Let dying people drink what can intoxicate {them}, and let miserable people drink wine.

title: Proverbs 31:7
content: 7 They can drink {what can intoxicate them} to forget that they are poor and to completely forget what troubles them.

title: Proverbs 31:8
content: 8 Defend those who cannot speak {for themselves}; {defend} all those who are dying so that they get what they legally deserve.

title: Proverbs 31:9
content: 9 Defend, judge rightly, and plead for suffering and poor people to get what they legally deserve.

title: Proverbs 31:10
content: 10 Virtuous and capable women are difficult to find! This kind of woman is more valuable than precious jewels.

title: Proverbs 31:11
content: 11 Her husband completely trusts her, and he will always gain many things {because of her}.

title: Proverbs 31:12
content: 12 Such a woman benefits her husband for as long as she lives.

title: Proverbs 31:13
content: 13 She gets materials to make warm and cool clothing, and she enjoys making that clothing.

title: Proverbs 31:14
content: 14 She is like merchant ships because she brings her food to her home from distant places.

title: Proverbs 31:15
content: 15 She gets up before dawn in order to prepare food for her family and some {food} for her female servants.

title: Proverbs 31:16
content: 16 She buys a field after planning carefully. She uses some of what she earned by working to plant a vineyard.

title: Proverbs 31:17
content: 17 She vigorously prepares herself to work hard, and she makes her arms strong {by working hard}.

title: Proverbs 31:18
content: 18 She knows that what she does is very profitable. She works late into the night.

title: Proverbs 31:19
content: 19 She makes thread {for clothing} with her own hands.

title: Proverbs 31:20
content: 20 She helps poor people and suffering people.

title: Proverbs 31:21
content: 21 She is not worried that her family will be cold during cold weather because her whole family has the best warm clothing.

title: Proverbs 31:22
content: 22 She makes her own blankets to cover beds. She wears clothing made from expensive cloth.

title: Proverbs 31:23
content: 23 People respect such a woman’s husband at the {city} gates, and he sits {there} with the {other} leaders of the city.

title: Proverbs 31:24
content: 24 This woman makes clothing and sells it. She also sells belts to merchants.

title: Proverbs 31:25
content: 25 People notice how strong and dignified she is, and she is cheerful about what will happen in the future.

title: Proverbs 31:26
content: 26 She speaks wisely, and when she speaks, she teaches {others} to be faithfully kind.

title: Proverbs 31:27
content: 27 She carefully watches what happens in her household, and she is never lazy.

title: Proverbs 31:28
content: 28 This woman’s children stand respectfully and declare that she lives happily. Her husband says good things about her as well.

title: Proverbs 31:29
content: 29 He says to her, “Many women have acted virtuously and capably, but you indeed have done better than them all!”

title: Proverbs 31:30
content: 30 Charming women {who are not good} can deceive people into thinking that they are good, and beautiful women will not remain beautiful forever. However, people will praise those women who reverently fear Yahweh.

title: Proverbs 31:31
content: 31 Give to such women what they have earned, and praise them publicly for what they have done.
